text: Max's Take Out is a hole in the wall located two blocks from Millennium Park. Typically when I think of hole in the wall, I think of exceptionally tasty food for a great price. However I can't say the same for Max's. My friend and I wanted to try out a Chicago dog from the great city itself from another place, however due to the weird hours of the other establishment we stumbled upon this place based on the excellent Yelp reviews.  We each opted for two of their hot dogs and a drink running in close to $10. The hot dog itself comes with the traditional toppings found in a Chicago dog, such as tomatoes, slice of pickle, and hot peppers. The hot dog itself was average and honestly tasted worst then a hot dog place I go to back at home in VA that specializes in Chicago dogs. The beef and bread itself were pretty lackluster in my opinion which led me to that conclusion. Overall, I was pretty disappointed with my experience here. This place is probably excellent when you get the munchies, however it just didn't satisfy my Chicago dog craving.

A great place in the loop for tasty Chicago hot dogs. We also ordered the Polish dog to taste the difference. Both were delicious and service was quick. They have a small counter area with seating for 10 persons to eat in.

I had a Chicago Jumbo Hot Dog.  Too high priced and not particularly tasty.  The price posted on the wall was wrong and they charged me a higher price.  When I asked what's going on, the kid at the counter said that they hadn't gotten around to changing it.  Not a way to run a business.

4.5 stars. Ordered two Chicago dogs, and an Elote fries (which isn't on the menu.) Filled me up for lunch! Hot dogs were good, as fries were too. Simple and quick. You order and the cashier writes your order on a paper bag, which your order comes out in. After you order, you just step to the side and wait for your food to come out. There are, I want to say, 10 seats along the left when you walk in. There are napkins and hand sanitizer on the right. The only reason I gave a slight deduction would be because the cashier wasn't super personable, just seemed like he wanted to get the job done. Overall, definitely a good spot for people working in the loop!
Great service, quick to prepare, awesome food! Crowded line goes quick and the workers are very friendly
Found this in Yelp!  A nice little hotdog place great cheese fries and you know it is good when you see people from the community in the restaurant!  Will go again if in the area!
I order for delivery in the West Loop all the time. Great flavor beef, pretty good gyro flavor, and quick delivery.

Hands down best hot dog I've ever had -- never mind that it was a Chicago dog, this was truly delicious regardless of style. Don't let the casual takeout tiny joint discourage you. It's worth the visit if you want to get a local taste of the Windy City.

I tried the hot dog with everything and the Italian beef, dipped and with sweet peppers. The hot dog was really good. Vienna beef dog, relish, onions, mustard, tomatoes, hot peppers, and a pickle all stuffed into a poppy seed bun. The Italian beef was good but it somehow left something to be desired. Not sure how else to describe it. I would recommend both but if I had to choose one I'd go with the dog. The place itself is a typical takeout kinda spot, small with a line of counter top seating. Service was good, could tell that it was slwoing down as things got busier though. Would definitely recommend this place.
Good stuff. Hole in the wall with good food. If you're on the go and want a quick lunch or bite this fits the bill. Guy at the counter is a nice guy.

GREAT Chicago dogs! Takeout only. There is No seating here, but in a short walk, you can enjoy your dog on the steps of the Chicago Art Building. It is crowded. You order at the counter and step back, but the service is quick. Nice snap to the dog, perfectly sloppy and flavorful. The ingredients are fresh. I wish I'd ordered a few of these!!!

Best cheeseburger I've ever had!!! This place deserves more than 5 stars! Whenever I'm in Chicago this is a must go to! I'm not a hot dog person but my family loves the hot dogs and chili dogs as well, but my personal favorite is the double cheeseburger. So so good! My mouth is watering as I'm writing this. Simple perfection!
Not very clean and really run down, but the customer service was  friendly and the price is right so the deal is real!
Out of this world cheeseburgers that won't hurt your wallet!!!! Fantastic value if you're short on cash and happen to be downtown!!

Tiny hot dog joint off the beaten path, but such a perfect slice of the American dream, I have to give this a 5 star across the board. The lady friend, and I went here after the St. Patric's Day Parade, and just wanted something to commemorate our first trip to the city together "food wise". Lol What's better than a perfectly cooked tube steak, with a steamed bun, dragged through the garden, and wrapped in waxed paper? Nothing! The place was packed, so we at outside on the sidewalk, and people watched. Perfect ending to a great day! Will definitely eat here again!

This is the quintessential Chicago hot dog joint, right in the middle of the Millennium Park fray (but don't be fooled, you can get MUCH more than just hot dogs here). In 5 minutes you can order, eat and be on your way to the next exciting Chicago adventure. I got the jumbo dog fully loaded, sans onion, and despite my concern with the employee not writing down my "don't put onions on my food or my guts will explode" plea - or anything - it came out as ordered. The jumbo is about 8" for a total of $4.44 with tax. I came in here to stave off the hanger of walking around for 8 hours, not drinking any water and wanting to wait til dinnertime to eat dinner (bad idea, oh well). The jumbo dog held me over for about 3 hours with very little besides coffee in my system since breakfast. I didn't bother with fries or a drink or anything, and this is not a cozy spot to sit and eat, but it's completely functional for what it is - a kitchen cranking out FAST, delicious food.  Note: they do not accept American Express. Cash, debit or visa/MC.
Hole in the wall. Ordered the gyro cheeseburger ($6.59). Very friendly people and the burger was pretty good. Always nice supporting local businesses!

I can't express enough how grateful I am for my experience with Max's. I ordered take out for my lunch break at work, but when o got to Adams there was a high rise fire and the street was closed! I called Max's, expecting to cancel my order. The man on the phone insisted he could have the food BROUGHT TO ME! I waited at the intersection and a very friendly employee came and dropped my food off for me. Had I had cash on me I would have given him a tip for his trouble, and I plan to be back so hopefully he will be there when I return! But the most important thing, obviously, is the quality of the food. I got the double charburger with Mozzarella. It was fresh and delicious and for a great price. Undoubtedly the best burger I have had downtown. I recommend Max's for a quick lunch to enjoy at the local parks!!!
Far and away the BEST burger, beef, dog joint in the Loop. Not those chains, not Al's, not Shake Shack, Max's Take Out is the place to get a greasy lunch.

Stopped in to get a quick polish- which was delicious! My first time dining here, but the food and positive experience with the owner earned a bookmark in my Yelp. This is now on how list of places to eat when downtown.

You can order online ! Which is a great plus if you want to skip the line at lunch. The gyro cheeseburgers are great. The fries not so much. More of a take out place, but there are seats here too, non fussy, functional type of environment for a quick bite. If you want halal burgers order from the zabihah halal section!

Total hole in the wall type hot dog stand right in the heart of the Loop.   Service is non-existent, but it's orders come out fast and accurately. Hot dogs have a stellar snap to them. That casing is on point!  Pizza puffs weren't done correctly and came out pretty soggy and gross, no crispness to the dough. Everything here is A-OK and I'd go back in a jam. Definitely not a destination food spot though.
Might be better on another night, but they decided to close early the day I stopped by for a quick hot dog.
True hole in the wall that delivers on the dogs. Soft steamy bun, good sized Polish and fresh fixings. A must stop if in the area and the real option when at the Art Institute.

One of my favorite meals during my week long trip to Chicago. I wasn't expecting much but I LOVED the Chicago dog. It was definitely the best hot dog I have ever had.  Catch that, the best dog I have ever had and probably the meal from Chicago I remember with the most fondness.  When I return to Chicago I have several places on my to do list and this is definitely on my must do AGAIN list.

I stopped by Max's after dropping off my TSA Pre-Check application and my polish with everything did not disappoint. Just the right amount of snap and chew in the meat and the bread cooperated nicely by holding in all the trimmings. I love to drive while I consume my polishes, so having a stable, one handed treat is key. The french fries were also pretty amazing.  The line moved very quickly. Despite this, I did not make it to the parking garage pay station before the meter ticked past 20 minutes and charged me an additional ten dollars. Considering, however, that included my time with Homeland Security, I'll chalk it up to the cost of tasty exploration. Three cheers for Max's in the Loop!

Great people make for great food.  We were on our way out of town and really wanted a Chicago Dog.  Best dog I've ever had at a really reasonable price.  By the way, the cheese fries and garlic tater tots hit the spot as well.  This is a must stop whenever in downtown Chicago.  See you next trip.

This review is based on their way of doing business,  not their food as I didn't have an opportunity to eat there. It was 7:40 on a Saturday and I called to place an order for carry-out before they closed at 8pm. They said they were closed. I asked if I could walk in and place an order (staying at hotel across the road), assuming they stopped taking carryout orders shortly before closing. Again, I was told "no."   When I tried confirm they were open until 8, they told me they closed early, at 7pm that day. It's very disappointing when businesses don't stick to their posted hours.  I was looking forward to trying this restaurant.

Totally disappointed with the way they treat their customers!! Called to place an order for pickup and the person who picked up the phone rudely said "can you place the order online?" I said "actually i can't because I already tried and my order would not go through" . She said "I'm busy right now".... WOW. She could have said give me one second please but instead she decided it was okay to lose a customer.
Best cheese burger ever! Quick with my order. It has that Chicagoan neighborhood feel
This is a Chicago Loop culinary landmark. Savor the tradition. The fries are perfect. The hot dog traditionally sublime. And, you can have it all for under $7.00.

I go here for lunch about once every week or so. Tourists: this is good place for your Chicago hot dog experience. Today they accidentally gave me fries. I didn't ask for them. They didn't charge me. I found out when I got back to the office. I figured the least I could do was thank them here with a nice review.

I had the Gyro Cheeseburger and tasted the Char Grilled Chicken and Spicy Char Grilled chicken sandwich. I would suggest getting the Gyro or Char Grilled. The spicy chicken sandwich was not good because it's not a traditional spice, it's more of a salsa, which I am not a fan of on my sandwiches.
My go to place when craving a juicy gyro cheeseburger and fries. Their service is fast and friendly, and the lady that takes my order over the phone is quite friendly.

The definition of, "hole in the wall." Good hot dogs fries and the burgers look great. But it's nothing special just what you expect from a good dog Stand in a literal hole in the wall. Place is probably 9 feet wide. Service was fine. Food was hot. Tough to get a seat. Just down the block from the art Institute. Great place for a quick snack or lunch. Four stars on the hotdog scale. Three stars on the restaurant scale. Enjoy!
Cheap prices and delicious food. One of the best hot dogs I've ever had!

My first time visiting Chicago and I was definitely SUPER impressed about Max's. All the staff were extremely friendly and welcoming, making me feel right at home in this teensy establishment. This tiny place packs a huge punch. My boyfriend and I had a little bit of everything and were not disappointed at all. Their French fries were cooked to perfection and the chili they use was bursting with flavor. I would not recommend this establishment for a large group of people as it really is a "hole in the wall." There was only enough room to seat maybe 10 people. Would be perfect for a drunk snack to soak up all the alcohol after a night of clubbing!   I will definitely return to Max's the next time I'm in Chicago. This place is a local favorite and for good reason! Give it a chance, you will not be disappointed.

Got hot dogs and polish sausage, not bad but didn't knock my socks off either. Average at best. Really wanted to be wowed. Liked the polish dogs better than the hot dogs. Would give it another shot but would try something else first. Service was quick and they were friendly.
They have the best hot dogs! They have halal menu in the store. It's not on the signs.

I usually get the gyro burger.. this time it was extremely bland and cold. Employees prepared my food with bare hands so that was disgusting. Also got cheese fries( tasted horrible and artificial), there was a plastic piece wrapped around a fry, I could've choked on. Definitely not returning
The BEST Chicago dogs around!! Right in the Loop area, great people over there! I'm a fitness gym rat but love a good Chicago dog, can't go anywhere else but here!!!
Great food, great prices. If you are in Chicago you need to visit this place. The people who work here are very helpful.
Amazing Gyro Burger! I was actually surprised by how good it was considering this place is a total hole in the wall! Fries are awesome too! Very good experience!

I did the $5.99 hot dog special and it was delicious! It came with fries and a fountain drink. I'm not from Chicago so I am not the guy to judge what an authentic Chicago dog is/should be. But what I can say is that this hotdog was so good for the price you pay, especially considering the location of Max's. The fries were hot and crispy and the service was friendly!

Just go. It's what a Chicago dog should be. Cheap, fast, no frills experience. In one bite you get the snap of the dog, tomato, pickle, relish, mustard, hot pepper, celery salt and fluffy roll studded with poppy seeds. Oh my God. Good fries.

the hot dogs here are frekkin good.  I'm so glad we walked past this place while we were touristing it up in Chicago.  I really wanted to try a Chicago dog and good LORD.... YES.  Husband got a chili cheese dog, which was messy and finger lickin' good.  He really enjoyed it. The location is small, so it's not really somewhere I would go to sit down, but we went in, grabbed our dogs, and left.  Walked around while eating our dogs.  I was seriously considering doubling back for another once I finished mine.  I'm in love with Chicago dogs now.
Had a jumbo dog and beef sandwich. Both were good. The bread was fresh. It is a small place but the food is good and the prices are low.

The hot dogs here are pretty damn delicious! I am beyond glad that I got to try a Chicago style dog while in Chicago, because it is pretty much a game changer. My love of Costco hot dogs have just been demoted to second place. I don't know the difference between a jumbo dog and just a regular hot dog, but I decided to get the jumbo dog here (someone please tell me if you know, thanks!)  I did not realize a Chicago dog was going be topped with all kinds of things and was surprised when I unwrapped mine. It was topped with sport peppers, a pickle slice, tomatoes, relish, and celery salt.  IT WAS DELICIOUS AF!! It is within my top 3 favorite meals that I have had in Chi-town! All the toppings go well together, and I don't even think it needs any condiments. IT'S PERFECT JUST THE WAY IT IS!  On top of how delicious their Chicago dog is, this place is really close to THE BEAN and the Art Institute. So grab your edible dog, maybe your pet dog if you got one, and enjoy it right in front of Chicago's forever glorius architecture.

i just left max's so the anger still burns brightly.  i've had plenty of gryos; hundreds manybe? some good, some bad, some great, some terrible. this was THE WORST.  also, the most expensive from a hot dog joint.   to be fair, i've had average/fine hot dogs from max's in the past.
Yum yummm. Definitely our favorite hot dog place in the whole city. We've tried Chicago style at many other places, but nothing beats Max's in terms of taste and price. Love it!

Great little hole in the wall serving the Chicago classics.  Lots of places downtown to get some dogs, and Max's does it right.  A generous Maxwell Street Polish, and the lady's first Chicago Dog:  "This is perfect!  A hotdog AND a salad"
Classic hole in the wall with AMAZING food! They are the oldest Chicago dog in The Loop. We got our food and ate it in the park. Highly recommend for good ole classic sandwiches

Bewildered out-of-towner meandering through the randomness of this mega town; came across the Chicago style hot dog, a monstrosity of a creation; crunchy, chewy, savory, acid, sweet, spicy, mustard, celery salt... It's confusing and it shouldn't work, but it does and I love it.

This small little joint is in a great location since it is within walking distance of popular attractions like the Art Institute and the bean.  It has quick service and is a great takeout place. It serves food that are Chicago foods, like the italian beef and Chicago hot dog. Both of those items are good. They also serve other items like fries and gyros. This was my first Chicago hot dog when I first visited Chicago since it was so close to the Art Institute and the bean.

We got the chili cheeses fries, jumbo dog with everything, and an Italian beef combo. The fries were perfect amount, served hot, and just plain wonderful. We have always gone to Al's Beef for the Italian beef but this was just as good if not better. The beef is thinly shredded so a little crumbly but very tasty.

The italian beef sandwich isn't pretty but it's tasty and that's all you should care about. Make sure you get it dipped and that you have a couple napkins handy because you'll need them. I prefer sweet peppers but you should probably just get hot and sweet.

Great place to grab a bite. Awesome taste and good prices. The Grilled Char Chicken sandwich is my favorite. The best thing is that they serve zabiha-halal burgers which are not abundantly available in the city.

This was on our list of things to try during our trip and we were so excited! We ordered the classic Chicago-Style Hot Dog with all the condiments. Our hot dog was freshly prepared and ready in less than 5 minutes. The flavors were wonderful, a little sour, savory, and spicy as well from the peppers. Definitely a change from the hot dogs we were used to back in Texas. The celery salt was a bit too much though, and made our pickle so salty with each bite! Other than that, our experience was pretty great. This place does have very limited seating though, enough for only about 10 people. We came during an off-peak hour at about 4 and were able to find seating without any problem. As a plus, this place is only about a 4 minute walk from the Art Institute, perfect for that late afternoon snack ;)

First time visitors in Chicago- had to get a real Chicago dog and they did not disappoint! It was delicious! Also tried the Italian beef which was pretty good! Definitely get a chicago dog here and enjoy the area. The guy taking orders was very nice and everything was efficient.

DAMN GOOD HOT DOGS! especially if you eat halal! Chicago Hot Dog, Chile Hot Dogs were amazing. Good street food in Chicago. Don't expect some gourmet stuff. This is street food, so set your expectations accordingly.

To be honest, I stumbled upon this place by accident and as I was reading the amazing reviews afterward, I am so glad that we decided to stop by. A friend and I were looking for a classic Chicago hot dog and I guess this place is it! They have burgers and fries and other fast meals but take my advice and get one of the hot dogs (normal, jumbo, or polish). With all the toppings and NOT ketchup so if you're taking it to go as we did, plan accordingly. There's not a whole lot of seating, it's mostly standing, but there's plenty of places to sit around in the nearby vicinity. Super friendly staff, too. Since locals mostly inhabit this place, as a tourist, I knew we had chosen well!
So unique & delicious! Got the Chicago style polish dog. The owner was really friendly and the service was quick!  Would def come back when I visit again!

Great place to grab a bite when getting ready for a good meal. We stopped by and got thr food fast.. downside , there is no bathroom and  no place to wash your hands (i know supposed to be take out, but sanitizer could work and they dont have it). Fries are a delight hotdog Chicago style and no ketchup please. Interesting they have tamales :)

You know when you're having a terrible day and you just need comfort food to lift your spirits or help you get over your jet lag? Well Max's Take Out hits the spot! This is my go-to place when I need some pick me up food. Literally my hidden treasure, it is tucked away in the heart of shopping galore near State street. I work near Monroe and Wells and I walk a couple of city blocks just to eat this delicious hot dog because it's just that good! It is always packed during lunch time so I recommend going after 1:00 pm when things have died down. They are freakishly fast so expect your meal to be done rather quickly. I am literally in and out in minutes. For $8.00, I get a Chicago style hotdog, cheese fries and a drink but they also have burgers, gyros and a large menu. For anyone that works in downtown Chicago, we all know what a steal that is, especially for delicious food. I personally appreciate that you can see how the food is made since they have an open kitchen. They do take credit card and cash. They don't have an actually area where you can sit and eat, it's more of a place where you stand and eat. I usually walk to the Gardens of the Art Museum and enjoy lunch there!  Ps. I don't care what anyone says- a hot dog is incomplete without ketchup so my Chicago style hot dog includes ketchup!

Second visit in two days!!!  Quick Chicago hot dog and Italian beef Sammich lunch yesterday but enjoyed it so much we were trying to figure when we'd be back. Had fancy steak dinner plans for our last night here but ended up back after the Jazz fest instead. No regrets!  Thank you Becca and crew!  Shout out to "Montanez" from PR!

Just pure, perfect, greasy-hole-in-the-wall bliss. Me and the lady wolfed down a dipped Italian beef with sweet peppers, a loaded jumbo dog and a side of fries, immediately morphed into Chris Farley for 26 seconds, shouted "Da Bears!" and then returned to normal, completely satiated, fingers sticky with chicagoey residue. I'll never forget you Max's

I came here after a walk in millennium park with my brother and mother. Sadly we had dinner plans so my brother and I just shared a dog. It was my first Chicago dog, which was extremely overwhelming being a New Yorker where our hotdogs are pretty minimalistic. I got to say the hot dog was really good! Even though I am also really picky about processed meats like hot dogs. So as long as I wasn't thinking about what really goes into a hotdog it was a great experience. The fries were also really great! My mother doesn't really like fried foods and we were almost fighting over who was eating more fries. This place is definitely better for take out (as it says in the name) the store is a little cramped.  As a pretty young looking teenager, I was slightly ignored when ordering but I'm used to it.

This is where you go when you say you want a Chicago hot dog.  They originate from here, not the stork like your parents told you. This is the patient zero of Chicago hot dogs. This is the nucleus of the Chicago hot dog. I hope I made my point.  Worked in the loop for 9 years, never disappointed to come to Max's.  Awesome staff that knows how to hustle and move the line.  Menu is what it is - takeout food at its best.  Hot dogs, polish sausages, gyros, pizza puffs, burgers, chicken sandwiches.  It's all here for your fast food indulgence.  Yes, get fries, why else are you here? Currently in this gyro and a cheese fry rhythm.  Get it about once every 3 weeks.  Couldn't be more satisfied.

Went looking for cheap, quality eats around downtown Chicago and we came across Max's with 4 Stars. We got the Double Cheeseburger, 2 Cheese fries and a Gyro. Cheeseburger - 2/5 The bun, tomatoes and sauces were the only things that made this any different than a McDonald's burger right next door. Patties were so thin that I felt like I wasn't even eating 1!! I don't recommend it. Cheese fries - 1/5 There isn't much to expect from a $3 order of cheese fries and Max's was no exception. Hardly seasoned fries and a gooey tasteless fake cheese on top. Not much to say besides DONT GET IT. Gyro - 3/5 The meat was cooked just fine, but it was lacking in flavor even having asked for "Everything on it." It came with a couple slices of tomatoe and some yogurt sauce. Definitely one of the lesser Gyros I've had.  Overall 2/5. Look elsewhere for a burger and fries.

I was looking forward to going to this place since I heard they have a separate HALAL menu. So I was in the city (which rarely happens) decided to give it a shot. Called in and placed an order for pick up. Picked up the food and realized that they had messed up on my order, which was frustrating because I didn't have the time to go back and get my order corrected. So anyways i had the Gyro Cheeseburger, the burger was a decent size and the meat was cooked to perfection, only negative was that it was a little bland, not enough flavor to it. So overall my experience wasn't a great one, hopefully next time its better.
Chicago dogs were okay, but I wish there was more seating inside!

Max's Take Out is this small, hole in the wall place that sells a bunch of fast food items. They have hot dogs (Chicago style, since you are in Chicago), hamburgers, Italian beef, Gyros, and more.  Their place is small. They have limited seating. So if you want to eat there, you might end up standing and eating. Or you can take it to someplace.  I tried their jumbo hot dog and Italian beef. They were both good. Was it gourmet? No. But it was your simple and delicious hot dog and Italian beef. Oh, get the Italian Beef dipped and with the hot peppers for that extra heat.  Their ordering is efficient. The dude on the counter looks rough but is very nice. If you want to try a nice, cheap hotdog or Italian beef, check out this place. Oh, they don't take American Express.
How a Chicago dog should be from a place with no atmosphere...that gives it tons of atmosphere.

My last stop on my trip. Side note:  this was the first place my dad and I went to circa 2012 when we went to Chicago.  I had to stop here before I left to get some hand held Chicago eats. It's a fast food take out specializing in Chicago cuisine.  Of course I did the Italian beef and a Chicago style hot dog.  The Italian beef is what wet food dreams are made of; literally they're wet due to dunking your sandwich in the broth (you can get it dry if you're not adventurous).  Topped with sweet peppers and hot peppers and some mozzarella for the baddest of concoctions. The Chicago hot dog is one fine looking wiener with garden toppings (yellow mustard, neon green relish, chopped onions, dill pickle, tomato wedges, sport peppers, & celery salt) in a soft poppy seed bun.  If you've never had one, it's a piece of culinary art that's a must eat. The employees have a lot of pride in their food and it shows in the taste.  Want authentic Chicago?  Max's gets it done!
Omg the double gyro cheeseburger is the best burger I've ever had. It's also halal! I don't live in Chicago anymore and I still crave it!
Yup, I'm going to go ahead and give it a 5. Because the staff were super friendly, great Chicago dog, and right off the L. Recommend!

10/10 Hawaiian burger. I got it without the lettuce, tomato, and thousand island because I am not a big fan of that stuff. It was very good and so were the cheese fries. Everyone in my family found something to eat that they enjoyed. It was very well priced for a place in Chicago. I definitely recommend it.
$3.48 for a regular Chicago style hot dog. There were a few peppers on it but not too hot, the hot dog itself was one of the better ones I've had. All in all a taste experience.
Cheap lunch done right.  Loved my gyro burger.  Good deal and fast.  What more can you want?

Order at the counter.  Grab your food.  Eat at the stand up counter and soak into the glory of a solid chicago dog.  Yes, they have burgers (which are no frills but not bad) but their hot dogs shine.  Just don't use ketchup on it-blasphemy!

Came here on a suggestion from my daughter's college friend. We ordered the Chicago dogs and fries. It was tasty, complete with tomatoes, a full pickle, relish, mustard and a hot chile. Tasted great and I'd be back for another when in Chicago. The place is a small storefront amidst the tall skyline of Chicago. The ambiance is real, no frills and prompt service. When in Chicago try Max's take out. Don't let the name fool you, there is a counter seating along the wall within the narrow walk-way but not much.
placed a big order for colleagues.  it was delivered very quickly, still hot, and overall was a great value.

We found this hole in a wall place only through Yelp but it was the real deal.  It's literally about six feet wide but they do have a bar and chairs lining one wall for quick chowing down.   We split a Chicago dog, an Italian beef and an order of fries.  Everything was made to order and absolutely delicious.   This is not fancy.  But this is delicious and this is real Chicago food.  Check it out!

Very small place and for the life of me I don't know how they remember one's name after taking an order. Every hot dog version known to man is here!! I had one minus the hot peppers but did order the cheese fries.
Very good cheeseburger and burger everything fresh and hot. Guys very quickly cook. French fries delicious. Thanks

This place had my second favorite Chicago dog of our visit (the one at Wrigley field won but that could have just been that I was at a Cubs game at Wrigley Field!!!)-my husband thought they were just fine. I loved that it was spicy, messy and it totally hit the spot as our first Chicago dog of the trip. I would happily come back when we get to Chicago next time! A perfect little hole in the wall place!

Even on a weekday during the lunch hour, Max's was quick (order, then pay - their system works alright). We split a Chicago dog, Italian beef sandwich, and a small order of fries.  I'd never had a Chicago dog before, but it was fantastic: delicious beef hot dog, crunchy pickle spear, and the yellow mustard were my favorite parts...everything else was practically falling out, it was so packed. The Italian beef sandwich was delicious and juicy. If you order it hot, it comes loaded down with a hot pepper mix (that also includes hot carrots/celery). It had a generous portion of meat, too; my one complaint would be that it soaked through the bread and made it soggy. Eat quickly.  The fries were good. I suggest a large portion for two people.  Easy walk to the L or the Art Institute as an added bonus.

I started eating at this location in my college undergraduate days (nearly a decade ago). Max's Take Out have delicious Burgers, Italian Beefs, and Chicago Style Hot Dogs (and many more items). I would highly recommend this restaurant for anyone to try.....

I don't remember much about my first Chicago hot dog from Portillo's other than how different and fresh it was, but I can tell you that I haven't had many hot dogs back home (in New York) since. I loved the idea of having fresh ingredients in my hot dog, rather slapping half-assed cooked meat in a bun with cheap ketchup and mustard and call that a hot dog. Chicago, you have upped my hot dog standards. Having had Max's Take Out bookmarked since my last trip (in 2012), I probably would not have randomly gone out of my way to come here had I not looked at my bookmarked places; this was pretty much my first meal right off the plane and I was starving. The one thing I'm still can't get used to is paying close to $4 for a hot dog, but then again, fresh ingredients are being substituted. The Jumbo Hot Dog was good--it had the essentials of a Chicago hot dog, but I didn't really like the celery salt, which was too strong for me and was lingering in my mouth even hours later. This place is small and can easily be missed, but a decent no-frills fast food join regardless.

Walked in there early. 10:00 on Tuesday. I like that they open a little early. People were very nice. I was the 1st customer of the day I'm sure. I had a hot dog, fries and a water. It was about $6.50. The food was good. fries were frozen (which I happen to like) . They were hot and crispy. What else could I ask for? The hot dog was well a Chicago dog. It was good. As good as you would expect. Some bar stools to sit down in and eat there if you like. They seemed to appreciate that I stopped by. All and all a very nice little take out joint near the Art Institute down town.

Max's Take Out was my go to place to try the famous Chicago style hot dog. I was recommended by a friend to go to Super Dawg's but never made it up that way so Max's would have to do.  Chicago style hot dog vs. New York style hot dog. The only difference in my opinion was the additional toppings. The hot dog itself was a normal size loaded up with mustard, relish, onions, a giant pickle, tomatoes, and hot peppers (I think I got them all). I'll admit once I had bitten into it the aroma of all of those ingredients combined gives off a nice taste. A little bit of sour and sweetness. However once I was half way into the dog itself I was kind of over the entire taste. I guess I was expecting more out of the bun itself or the hot dog itself instead it tasted like a NY style dog you would get from a stand filled up with whatever toppings you want.  On a lighter and positive note the fries were delicious and I got a good laugh out of the no ketchup rule unless you're under the age of 17. Of course they do have a bottle there for you if you would like and also throw in a few packets in the take out bag.  Could just be me but I'll take a hot dog with chili and cheese any day instead of all the crazy toppings.

One final stop in our Chicago food adventures lead us to Max's! Love the dive feel...Alll you truly need when chasing the best Chicago Dog in this city...  Very very fresh ingredients..Spicy! I dug that...The Fresh cut relish gave it that extra "Mmmmm.." I'm actually at loss for words since Max's hit the Chicago dog out of the park..Definitely rivals the big spots like Portillo's.. Max's dog was definitely bigger and about the same price so here at Max's, you're getting more for your buck! The huge crisp pickle was the cherry on top!  I highly recommend Maxs if you're looking for a good dog and not want to battle the big crowds..

Came in here on our walk to the Institute of Art and Millennium Park. It wasn't on the itinerary but we were hungry and wanted to try something that wasn't a chain restaurant or expensive. Max's has the makings of a hole-in-the-wall - local kids messing around near the front door with passerby's just stopping by for a quick bite. Being the tourists we were, we asked what the best thing to order was.  "Where you guys from?" "LA, heh." "Chicago Dog it is." So we both ordered a Chicago dog and a side of chili cheese fries. The fries weren't anything to talk about - it was good, but it wasn't any different than the ones at home.  The best way I can describe a Chicago dog is that it was like they threw hamburger toppings on a hot dog bun. Two big slices of tomato, pickles, onions and relish on top of a hot dog...but it works. Great for a quick bite as it'll tide you over until your actual meal (lunch/dinner).
Quick and friendly service. Almost missed it walking by however glad we stopped in. Very tasty food. Reminded me of a former place my dad and I used to eat at.

Max's take out. When someone says "hole in the wall" food joint, this is what they mean. Seeing as how this was my last stop to eat before having to fly back home to Los Angeles, I had to order the Chicago dog. I was not disappointed. Not the best Chicago dog I had that weekend, but still great enough to satisfy the craving. I was sad I didn't save enough room to try the gyro, but those chili cheese fries were just too good. The cheeseburger was fantastic as well. Overall I would definitely recommend Max's to anyone

This was my last stop before going back to Los Angeles and I had to have my first real Chicago Red Hot Dogs.  This place was right near me at the time and it was surprisingly good for a hot dog.  I didn't have much expectations but now I am a fan of the green relish and tomatoes on my dog (no ketchup).  LA joints don't have the same relish for their versions so i am glad I tried this place.

Awesome little place that was worth the walk in the cold. Had a regular hot dog (with everything on it of course, I got a huge piece of pickle), a chilli dog and fries (all three for less than 10 $ and I was pretty full afterwards..). Everything was very good, I would go there on a regular basis if I were living in Chicago and working nearby.. good location by the way.

I've mentioned to more than a few of my Chicago friends that the best hot dog in town consistently comes from Portillo's. This is sacrilege for some, so I've been given a list of other hot dog places to hit up to try to find a better dog. Max's was the first on the list. We got a huge spread of food, between normal hot dogs, a chili dog, a tamale, a pizza puff, and some cheese fries because why not. The pizza puff was off the chain, the tamale was great. (It had a more sweet corn flavor, which was interesting.) Cheese fries were awesome... But the hot dogs, I don't know, maybe I'm just an idiot from the 'burbs but I still like Portillo's better! Don't get me wrong, Max's dogs were VERY GOOD, but, I don't know, there's just something missing. What I will say is that the massive amount of celery salt they put on their hot dogs was A+. Definitely will be back next time I'm in downtown, I want to try an Italian beef but, well, I can only gorge myself so much in one sitting.

I've worked downtown near Max's for the last 11 years and have been a regular customer the whole time. Everybody else on this page has already praised Max's double cheeseburger, Polish sausage, Chicago style hot dog, and Italian beef with sweet peppers.  And I agree with them 100%.  But I don't think anyone has mentioned their excellent steak egg and cheese breakfast sandwich.  Try one, they're great too!
All you need to know about Max's: Get the POLISH Chicago, skip the regular Chicago dog. Actually, get two Polishes. Yum.
The 7.99 double cheeseburger special is really good the double burger is pretty big and the fries are too  Only thing is that the place is small & it gets crowded
Get your Chicago dog here ... enough said If you are in Chicago, especially if you are down by the Chicago Institute of Art stop by Max's, you will not be disappointed.

I will eat here any time I want a burger and I'm in the loop since I work relatively close. I'd say it's a hidden gem, but this place always has at least a few people in there, maybe more during busy lunch/dinner hours. I've only eaten the burgers, but I don't think you even need to bother with anything else. The double cheeseburger or, when I'm feeling fancy and like not eating anything else for the day, the gyro burger. Every time. That gyro burger is a double patty burger WITH gyro meat and a side of tzatziki sauce. Noms. I don't bother with fries -- it just leaves less room for that delicious double patty burger (though the fries are good too!). Oh right, every burger comes with two patties.  My power move will be to order a burger if I'm on my way to a concert or something where I know I'll be queuing to get in, put that foil-wrapped bit of deliciousness in my purse, and eat it in line half an hour later when I get to my destination. You will make people jealous as you eat it. ... now I want a burger. Damnit.

Spicy Chicken sandwich was awesome!!! That bread was so yummy and the spice was just right. The fries were good but needed a little more salt. Plus everyone was super nice. The delivery guy was so patient with me due to the confusing address. Can't wait to order again.
Solid halal spot. Really wanted an authentic halal Chicago dog and this place nailed it. Chilli cheese fries were pretty good also. Would definitely come back/ recommend.

Max's is definitely no frills.  It's a small hole in the wall where you can get a quick dog, and they deliver.  The hot dog was right up there with the more well known places like Portillo's.  Service was quick and efficient.  It's a good place to just come in if you want a quick eat or you want to cure those hangover blues.
This place runs like a well oiled machine! I hope to be as spry as the older gentleman in the baseball cap who runs the register.

I really like this little place. I ate lunch here for the first time today with my husband. I ordered a regular hotdog with cheese fries and my husband got a polish dog with fries. The hotdog has a nice snap to it and the taste is spot on. The fries are also really good. They take your oder and the wait isn't very long at all. Everyone seems to be very efficient. There's only a small bar with stools so if they're busy, plan on takeout.

Nice, convenient place downtown to get a Chicago dog. There are a few other items on the menu like pasta dishes, but I would suggest sticking with the dogs. I wouldn't skip on the fries, which you can get covered in cheese or chili cheese. And then you can go to the fries stand and put your own seasoned salt and flavored seasonings on top! Nice, quick place that is reasonably priced and great to take your friends to get a classic Chicago dog with all the fixin's.

Went here for a quick bite to eat after visiting the Art Institute. Do NOT get the Chicago hot dog. It's small, overpriced, and had neon green bell peppers (food dye!?) that tasted funny. You can get the chili cheese fries, which were actually amazing, but man... I gave a terrible first impression to my visitor from out of state. Gotta redeem the Chicago dog elsewhere before she leaves. I should have known better than to take her to a place I've never tried!

If you eat halal meat, this is one of those places you have to check out. Even if that doesn't apply, this is still a place you have to check out. This is that type of place. It's great and just happens to also be halal.  Spicy Gyro Double Cheeseburger and Jumbo Chili Dog. That's what I usually have and enjoy it every time. They make the trip to downtown worth it.

Solid Chicago-dog experience.  4 stars because I was there on a wet, freezing, snowy day and having a place to sit down indoors for a street dog was exactly what I needed.  Easy access off the metro stop if you're heading to the Art Institute.

Top notch! I had the double burger with cheddar and was not disappointed. The brioche bun was soft and delicious. I topped it off with all the "garnishes" as well. Threw some fries on the side. Not particularly crispy, but thick! I'll certainly be back for a cheap delicious meal soon.
Delicious! Ordered online for delivery. Delivered timely and perfectly to how I specified. Absolutely brilliant! Would order again and would definitely recommend!
Tiny little hole in the wall. The burgers are awesome. This is a carry out only place. They make their patty very thin which gives a lot of flavor. Try the double gyro cheese burger.
Hole in the wall joint very busy the staff is nice the price is good and the hot dogs are too. I would recommend this place for a quick lunch close to some fun things in town.
I love this place and the food is great but over the years the prices have gotten to be ridiculous. $2 for the smallest french fries  I've ever seen.  Everything is ala carte.
Not very good. My dog can make a better hotdog/"cheeseburger." I don't even have a dog

So whenever I go to visit,the first thing I do is check on zabihah what halal places are around! When I came across this I quickly checked out it's yelp page and knew that I had to try it before leaving. I went to pick up their halal cheeseburger today for lunch and OMG it was sooo goood!! I loved it! so filling tooo!  I don't eat a lot of salt so the fact that it didn't have a lot of salt was awesome! Also it was like a 7 minutes walk. I love when I don't have to catch a cab just to pick up some lunch. I really hope I come back to Chicago so I can have all of this yummy food again.

Nothing incredible but a solid, affordable, quick place to grab a Chicago Dog or Italian Beef if you're in the neighborhood. I had both and they didn't let me down. I see they also have burgers, gyros and breakfast though I can't speak for those items.

Hole in the wall, didn't try the hotdogs nor the beef but I did try the cheeseburger and it was ok. I've had way better! The bread was a bit overwhelming, thick and too spongy. Prepare to wait for about 10-15 min, which is good because you know your food is made to order. I would  never order the burger again but if I'm in the area, would go back for a dog or beef.

The ultimate hole-in-the-wall.  A very small place with maybe 10 stools along one wall.  If you want fine dining with an expensive menu go elsewhere.  But if you want good food at a reasonable price this is one place that you don't want to miss.

Yum! I love getting an Italian Beef from Max's whenever I'm back in Chicago and staying in the Loop. This time I had them deliver it to me at the Silversmith Hotel, and it was amazing. Ordered a beef with hot peppers and mozz and an order of fries and it arrived quickly, and was still piping hot when I dug in. The gentleman who delivered was very nice, and very prompt. They had given me an estimated delivery time of 5pm, and it arrived by 4:30. The beef is delicious. I ordered mine on the dry side, so that the bun would keep its integrity through the delivery and so I could keep my dignity while eating it. it was perfect! My only wish is that it had more hot peppers, but I'm sure if I had ordered extra, I would have gotten extra.

We were visiting Chicago for a long weekend and needed to get "Chicago Style Hot Dogs" at least once, and the nice woman behind the desk at the Art Institute pointed us to Max's. The outside is inconspicuous and overbearing. We both ordered hot dogs with "everything" - trying not to scream "WE'RE NOT FROM HERE" while doing so, but the nice man behind the counter couldn't have been nicer and more welcoming. The dogs themselves were great, rich in flavor & nicely balanced by the myriad of toppings. My favorite topping was the sport pepper - why aren't these things in more dishes? Like the name says, it's definitely more of a take out place, but we squeezed into a spot at the counter and wolfed down our hot dogs.

Great dogs and burgers. So fantastic we stopped here twice on our way to Grant Park. Right off the "L", it is near everything. I have never had a Chicago dog before and I am hooked! This is just a take out place and popular with the locals. There is counter space to sit and eat though. Terrific if you are looking for a quick tasty bite or something on the go.

I've walked by this place a number of times. I was on the quest for a nice light lunch - a salad or a grilled chicken breast with some veggies or something along those lines. And then reality smacked me "Dave, you need an Italian beef and fries!"  Everyone knows Chicago is the only place for good Italian beef. There are some big names out there - Al's, Mr. Beef, etc...and everyone has their favorite. Of course there are always the places that surprise you.  Max's wasn't a life-changing beef - like Bombacigno's or Novi's (Berwyn), but it certainly didn't suck. The beef was tender. The bread had a good firm chew without needing to be dipped, but good enough to secure the contents of my sandwich for the entire duration. The peppers were hot. The cheese was melted. The fries were good as well.  This is a small place with a long counter to sit. It seems most of their business is carry out. I'll try a gyro or burger on my next visit.

Yelp comes through yet again! Stopped by for one last meal before heading to the airport. SO glad I did. The gyro burger was probably one of the best burgers I've ever had. I was immediately salivating like a dog once I opened the wrapper. And that baby's looks didn't disappoint once I took that first chomp. The way the toasted buns, the gyro meat, tzaziki sauce, cheese, juicy patties, and condiments all partied together, it was downright awesome! I came in rather early, beating the lunch rush, and had time to chat with one of the cooks. They special order their unique egg buns from a local bakery and their meat from a butcher. This'll be one of the first places I'll be sure to hit up the next time I'm in Chi-town. Can't wait to try the other stuff on the menu.

This place was poppin' even at 2:00pm. But I'm glad we stopped by to grab a Chicago Dog and gyro.  Service was prompt and everyone we were with also enjoyed what they got. This is a great place to stop at for a true Chicago experience!

Came here for the Chicago style hot dog and it didn't disappoint! My girlfriend had the double cheeseburger on a brioche bum which was delicious. And we split an order of cheese fries. Our food was delicious. Total cost around $16.

Max's is great.  It can get a bit crowded inside during the lunch hour, but the food is worth it.  The hot dogs are very tasty, and the fries are decent.  No frills, no fancy, just good food at decent prices.  Service is quick, which is a plus for those who work downtown and who don't have time to stand in line for half of their lunch hour.

How can you have a Chicago style dog without a poppy seed bun? Other than that SIN pretty good food. Reviewers are clearly tourists as I've seen no other mention of the non poppyseed bun. Wanted to fo to ub dogs but it was closed
I got my fist dog here. It was pretty yummy. I don't know what else to say except that it was very fast, cheap and convenient to my hotel. They seemed to have a lot of other yummy looking stuff too.

Came for the Italian Beef, wife had the Gyro Burger. Don't mess around get the burger! One of the best burgers I've had :) service was a little upsetting, trying to order and the counter associate was Spanish, girl next to me Spanish so they had to have some long conversation in Spanish and didn't take my order as I liked. Then waiting forever to pay while they finished there non-english conversation.... Frustrating. But dont let that detour you EAT A BURGER HERE! and stay at the Palmer Hotel
Ordered a burger to break my healthy diet and it was so good! Definitely not disappointing and quick service.
Great food! I've been going here for years and the food is always good. But it's a small hole in the wall. Don't be fooled.  It's really good food. Order the Gyros!

Walked by, looked in, walked past, walked away, walked back. Walked ten steps in on tile floor. Greeted with a head nod, from a friendly staff. Got the chicago dog. Dog good, easy on peppers and thick tomatoes and pickle on this guy.  Fries are standard, coke was cold, and ketchup was Red Gold.
Ordered a Gyro and fries....and I got a basic Gyro and fries.  Nothing was special about the food, it was something I could get at any Gyro place.  Flavor was basic.

Small place, so not really a lot of place to eat but should've guessed that by the name. However the burgers and the jumbo dog were pretty good. I was not as impressed with the fries though. However, I'd definitely go back again.
Don't WASTE YOUR MONEY OR TIME!!! Order took over two hours! Arrived cold, tasteless!  Owner gave excuse after excuse!!!
Best halal burgers in Chicago downtown. Don't even bother yelping other fast food places.

Delicious cheeseburgers that I'll walk 10 or 12 blocks out of my way for. They're thin patties but it's a double cheeseburger and it's served on a delicious Brioche bun. Probably my favorite downtown these days; way better than Shake Shack any day of the week.  Fries are good, too. Staff is super friendly.
Best hot dogs!! Everything we would have hoped the "Chicago dog" would be! Will definately be back when we're back in town.

Good service, we took my mom here for her first time for a Chicago dog. The difference between the polish and the regular hot dog is apparently just that the polish is a little bit more spicy, and it had a really good flavor. I agree with the others that I wish they had poppy seed buns. Get the polish dog!  Fast service, and a very unassuming place!

A friend of mine provided a list of great hot dog places in Chicago, and I chose Max's due to its proximity to Millennium Park. I wasn't let down. This place serves an excellent Chicago Dog. Also, the staff is friendly, efficient, and welcoming. I will return any time I have the opportunity.
Great double cheese burger and spicy chicken.. got delivery two blocks away, took over 1 hour.
My first even authentic Chicago style dog, not too shabby! The combination of flavors and textures really makes this special.

I absolutely LOVE Max's. Whenever I want a burger, I come here. I eat Zabiha Halal, so I make sure to ask for the Halal menu before I order. For some reason, every time I come here, I always order the spicy double cheeseburger. Oh my goodness, it is SO GOOD. It's super juicy, tastes fresh, and has a lot of flavor! I love the cheese fries, too. Although the place is small and can get crowded easily, I love the food and the customer service.
I ordered a gyro burger using the online delivery option and they gave me something else. I'm not sure what it was. It was good, but it wasn't what I wanted.

My first Chicago-style hot dog! Max's is right in the Loop so it was of course one of the first stops as a tourist visiting Chicago for the first time. Ordered a Hot Dog ($2.99)  with everything aka "Chicago style" -  hot dog, mustard, relish, pickles, tomatoes, onions, peppers.  The hot dog itself was very tasty and juicy. The only issue I had with it was the "skin" on it was pretty thick and chewy. Not my favorite type but it tasted good. Also I was a little disappointed (as a tourist) because Chicago hot dogs should have a poppy seed bun and this just had a plain hot dog bun. This may just be nit-picky but I expected poppy seed! Chicago Style hot dogs are delicious, by the way!
Tried a Chicago hot dog and it was very good, fries were a little greasy for my taste but went there for the dog.

Good burgers and gyros. Not too greasy like most other burger places. They tasted fresh and the portions were good sized. The fries were good as well. Place is a little small so I would avoid rush periods.

First stop on my trip to chicago! Gotta get a chicago dog. Actually ordered 2 dogs, fries and a drink. Total came out to slightly above $10. The place is no thrill, no nonsense,  and absolutely speedy service. The shop is located in the heart of downtown chicago. Very close to the bean and the park.  A good quality hotdog. I wouldnt mind coming back on my next trip to chicago

The gyro double cheeseburger is to die for! Anytime I visit Chicago I make it a point to go to Max's. The meat is really well prepared and the burger is quite large so it is very filling. Partial halal menu that is available at the location.
Great lunch special. Authentic feel. Don't come here expecting a hot dog with ketchup unless you want to look like a clueless tourist.
Being in love with all things east coast, it takes a lot for me to admit when I've been missing out.  The Chicago style dogs here are amazing, and possibly the best I've eaten.

I don't understand the love for this place I'm seeing in the reviews.  I order an Italian Beef dry - it comes soaked through the entire bottom bun.  Ask for another and the cook acts offended. Even after removing the giardiniera the seasoning is burn your mouth for an hour afterwards too hot.  And as at least one other review noted, it's way too salty.  Saved from the bottom by fast service (and the counter guy was nice) and a decent proportion/price.
A great little greasy spoon. The gyro burger is heavenly. Ask for a side of spicy sauce and say hi to Chris.
Classic chicago dogs and sausages. What else do you want?

If you want to feel like a local, come here to eat. This is a dont-take-your-jacket-off, eat-with-your-mouth-open type of place that will give you a legit Chicago dog for a good price. A Jumbo dog didnt really fill be up, so order a side or even two dogs if you are a big eater like me.  Service was still charming and courteous.
Great Chicago style fast food. Good flavor and in middle of downtown!
Amazing balance of hot dog and prime, delicious toppings chicago style. Best lunch grab around. Get a truck and 3x your business pls!

A visit to Chicago is said never to be complete without eating some steaming franks on hot dog rolls. That much I was certain about. But the question was, in a town known for processed meats, where do the working-class locals go to get their hot dog fix? To that end, I asked a Chi-town doorman for the best place to eat Chicago-style hot dogs. He in turn conferred with the rest of his uniformed coworkers, all of whom stood stiffly in front of a ritzy hotel off Michigan Ave, where I certainly could not afford to room.  "Magsses!" Replied a middle-aged, heavy-set African American doorman, without missing a beat.  Afraid I wouldn't find the place, unsure of what the man actually said, I carefully listened for directions. Directions which I promptly followed, being hesitant having to ask anyone else for directions, someone who may have a thicker accent still.   So Max's it was. A nondescript hole in the wall tucked among much fancier establishments. A few people stood in the lobby, waiting for their orders to be called as the kitchen crew toiled busily behind the counter and a balding gent stared as I approached the register.  Having never been there, I summoned all my non-existent Chi-cool and assuredly ordered hot dogs, whatever sounded best at the time. The order was promptly filled by a crew who doubtlessly has lost track of just how many hot dogs they must prepare daily.  As I put condiments of my hot dogs, the place, which had been filling up as I waited for my food, was by then full of hungry patrons, mostly white and appearing either like a motley cross section of downtown denizens or second-rate tourists, that is, just like me. The lobby, previously lined up with mostly empty stools, became almost impossible to navigate. Somehow, though, I found an empty spot and proceeded to chow. The first dog, the one with pickles and tomato, was . . . mediocre. Just. Meh. Luckily, I had possession of a second dog, on which my expectations now heavily fell. The second dog, a chilli dog, fared much better. But it simply was a pedestrian experience at best. Much like walking in at a DQ in Anywhere USA, where forgettable hot dogs are served to casual eaters, most of which couldn't care less about Chicago-style hot dogs, let alone Max's. But the second dog was the best of the two and boy, was I glad to have ordered it. The number of star on this review would have been lower, and my palate would also have been much sadder. Leaving the place, however, I felt a subtle pang of disappointment. And so I learned to never trust Chicago doormen on where to eat again.
Great burgers and chicken wings.  Very tasty and high quality stuff!
See why this place has good reviews. Can't go wrong here. Great burgers.  Pizza puff is yummy. Fries are real and fresh. Have had Max's a few times and it is consistently good.

Best double cheeseburger ever! I'm a big fan of burgers and max's burgers are definitely one of my favorite!!  It's a little pricey for a fast food joint but well worth it! They need to pick up their phones for pick up orders. Don't they know that people who work in downtown only get 30 minute lunch break?? But other than that, 5 stars!

We walked by this place on our way to the Willis Tower. My wife though it was sketchy looking so we did not go in. In line at the tower I checked my yelp app and showed her that the restaurant had good reviews. She was game! We ordered the hot dog basket with cheese fries. Good Chicago style dogs and you get plenty of cheese fries. Will be back to try more food.
If you are in the mood for a basic cheeseburger and fries, this is a great hidden gem in downtown where you can get your entire lunch for under $10.

It's a little hole in the wall. If you didn't find this on Yelp, you probably wouldn't think for a moment to try this place out. Bums stroll around outside, the place looks rundown, it just has no curb appeal whatsoever. But if you've decided to take a step in, along the way to the cashier, you'll notice several Chicago Dog posters from the past few decades. Chairs with a high bar table are situated along the left-hand side of the establishment. And then in the back is the overhead menu with cashier, and kitchen right behind. The two usual orders here are the Italian Beef Sandwich or Chicago Dog. I chose a Polish Chicago Dog ($3.89) which is a little thicker in texture and has a snappier skin. As I waited for my dog, I watched the chef carry several hot dogs from a refrigerated bin to put in a steam tray, where he proceeded to put water in the 2nd bed pan below. They were somewhat manhandled, hot doings going every which way in his two hands like the pick-up sticks game, with all hot dogs about to drop out of his hands at any moment. It all looked a bit disconcerting. If you can get over questionable preparation methods, read on. On top of the Chicago Dog is mustard, relish, onions, tomatoes, pickles, sports peppers, and celery salt. This almost classifies it a Chicago Dog except for one thing, Max's opted to use plain buns rather than a poppy seed bun. Thumbs down!! Now, if you can get over that slight oversight, then on to the hot dog. All the ingredients are standard-fare, evenly distributed along the length of the hot dog. But what are these huge quarter slices of tomato thrown on top? Large and obnoxious, dwarfing the size of the hot dog, I found myself taking a bite of it first to make the hot dog a little more appealing. Flavors are well-balanced, making for a fairly good hot dog, with the sports peppers adding some ample but tolerant heat. As far as a showstopper, it's nothing  memorable.

We stayed at the Palmer House Hilton and Max's was right outside and around the corner. We loved our first authentic Chicago dog- it was incredible! The place is small, but it gives it a nice ambience. The workers are efficient, friendly, and service is quick. The food was affordable too so I felt like it was a great deal for the quality of what you get. The hotdog was phenomenal! The fries were crispy and well seasoned. I really wish I had come back for another hotdog before I left town.

Convient take out spot in the loop. Limited counter seating inside. I walked in 10 minutes  before closing and the made everything fresh. The Italian beef and Chicago dog are both solid choices here. I was very pleased with the food and service. This is a 5 star takeout place.

While in Chicago, why not grab a Chicago dog?  I was at Millennium Park and was planning on staying for the free Jazz in the Park concert that evening.  I checked on Yelp to see where I could grab a good Chicago Dog nearby, and Max's was highest rated and near. It is a small small place, and unassuming.  It has a few seats along the wall, but it for sure is a take out joint.  I ordered my dog and fries, then walked back to the park....not far at all. The Chicago dog was good, but I've had better.  I would go back again if I was in the area, but out of convenience.  I wouldn't go out of my way.  However, it was a good dog, fries and coke combo for an evening of free jazz in the park.
I had the Halal double char burger! It was so good & healthy. Best burger I've ever had.

They say the small greasy hole in the wall spots are the best, and this place is just that. Appearance would scare many away, but they are making a mistake and missing out on some great Hot dogs and Italian beefs.
Excellent food for the price. I like the Italian beef with hot peppers... ask for it dipped (makes the bun moist) also like the  Italian beef / sausage combo. The burgers are tasty as well.
food was a little bit too salty.  I wouldn't eat here again. The place was empty when I got there, and they looked really dirty and old.

Staying close by and used their online system for ordering.  We had the Italian Beef and a Meatball sandwich with fries.  Food was ready promptly and efficiently.  Both sandwiches were well made with a healthy portion of meat.     Great place for a quick grab and go lunch.

A descent hole-in-wall eatery in downtown Chicago.  I found Max's Take Out to be a little too run-down for my taste but the customer service was pretty great so I do give them that.  The food was descent and for the prices you'll pay, I'd say it's a pretty good value.  Compared to other establishments, I didn't feel the food here measured up to them, but then again, I didn't have to pay as much either.  The quality didn't impress me all that much either.  Overall, I would say that if you never try Max's, you won't lose sleep over it, but if you're in a jam and could use a quick lunch/snack and are in the area, then Max's is a descent spot, or rather a pretty good backup option.

This was the first halal establishment that I became privy to Downtown! It's a little hole in the wall that you WILL walk past if you aren't looking for it.  It has a good, and separate, zabihah/halal menu, so be sure to ask for it. Skip the burgers, and go for the spicy chicken sandwich! It's a wonderfully moist chicken breast with some amazing sauce on a delicious bun (not one of those cheap hamburger buns you might get from other small burger joints). Wings and gyros here are okay, but that white sauce is to DIE FOR (I ask for some no matter what my order is).   This place is super accessible and really close to Downtown Islamic Center.  It's a good place to grab a bite to go and walk right on over to the Art Institute or Millennium Park and eat there.

One of those places where you're afraid to order the wrong way. People just yelling to you in that Chicago way trying to get you your food by the time you pay. Walk in and say, "Two hot dogs with everything, and fries." You'll be very happy and know you're in Chicago

I'm usually a plain Jane, my hot dog usually has only mustard and onions and an occasional sauerkraut, but I ordered everything on my Chicago style hot dog. I was not disappointed. It is possibly one of the best hot dog I've had in a long time. Must try!

I was passing by so I stopped in to have some Chicagoan food. I got an Italian beef sandwich with hot peppers and my husband got a Chicago style hot dog. The food was pretty good. It didn't blow us away. But it seems like a locals place so we were glad we tried it on our short visit here.

Pretty good food. Portions are really huge and the price is cheap. Great place to get a quick lunch in the loop. They are super busy during lunch but have a system down that will still get you out the door pretty quick.  Ps. They deliver too!

So I work in the area..every time I go in  the restaurant the cook, (the skinny slim guy in the back) always have a issue on how I want my food cooked.... Please make your customers happy...but that would be my last time going in there....and plus they customer service sucks...ugh

The reviews did not lie. I quickly walked over to Max's on my lunch hour and found a long line almost out the door.  The line moved quickly and when my turn came I placed my order over the heads of a few patrons and was asked no fries, my response-no fries.  The gyro burger was ready quickly and I inched my way to the front to pay and was asked no fries, my response-no fries.  I walked quickly back to the office and ate my gyro burger-it was hot, flavorful and had just enough of everything, then I wished I'd bought those fries.  On my next trip I'm having fries too. Don't let the appearance deter you it's worth the trip.

If a beef, sausage, or combo is what you're looking for, go for Max. While the tourist and some long-time locals might say Al's is better, I'll kindly disagree. It's not as crowded and frankly, I think the beef is better. Id suggest not getting it "dipped" since the bread here seems to basically disintegrate, which is never a good thing when you're shoving protein into your gullet.

This is the Rudy of burger joints in the loop.  By that I mean, the outside is 5 foot nothin, 100 nothing, and barely a spec of visual appeal to it.  But it packs a punch. It's about as close to an In-N-Out burger in Chicago as you're going to get.  Does that make it the best burger in Chicago?  No, but it's a pretty darn good burger and it tastes similar to that of the west coast chain. 4 not 5 stars because it's not the most filling burger, but it's a good price point. they also have flavoring for your fries. "Take Out" is in the name of the restaurant for a reason, and I would keep to that as this place is limited on seating. Overall, great little spot.

We stopped in by chance and were very happy with the experience.  The food was made quickly was tasted soooo good.  I had the combination of italian beef and sausage sandwich and my fiancee had the gyro cheeseburger.  Both were amazingly delicious.

Went here for lunch - they have a good selection of hot dogs, burgers, chicken sandwiches, fries, etc. I tried the double burger and fries for my first visit. The fries were good, but I was disappointed in the burger in that it was more comparable to McDonald's or Burger King in that the patties were slim and well done rather than the thick, juicy, medium cooked patties at Shake Shack for example. And yet the price is closer to Shake Shack. That being said, the staff was friendly, and the wait was not too bad during peak lunch hours (maybe 5-10mins). I may go back and try the chicken sandwich or hot dogs, but unfortunately I do not think I will be returning for the burgers.

They serve halal meat for muslims. But you have to ask for that specifically.   This place gets very busy during lunch time.  I recently ordered the cheese fries, and a burger. I thought the cheese fries were delicious. They were crispy fries perfectly coated in a cheddar cheese sauce. The double cheese burger was a pretzel bun, two 1/4 pound patties, cheddar cheese, and lettuce, tomato, mayo, ketchup and mustard. The burger was nothing special. It was a typical fast food burger. The food is okay, there is nothing special about it. I think you get what you pay for. This place is inexpensive. I think it would cost maybe a dollar or two more than a McDonald's combo meal. It is kind of a hole in the wall take out place.

So I decided to give this place a second chance. The first time I tried this place was in my pre-yelp days. Flash forward to present day and sheer, repeated disappointment.  Hot dogs folks. Not a hard item to nail. Steam them. Make them snap. Have a fresh bun with fresh ingredients.  Max's fell flat on its face. I could microwave storebrand hotdogs and put them on the bread people feed the ducks and probably would not have noticed the difference. Dont even get me started on the condiments. The peppers were crappy shells of former peppers and the tomatoes were left out too long. It really was a truly mediocre experience.

For what it is--a hole in the wall take out joint--it's great. A round glazed bun, delicious beef, and hearty toppings made my double burger a perfect (and inexpensive!) meal. I walked in and out of there in minutes too, even with a short line ahead of me.

For a little "hole in the wall" restaurant, the place is fantastic!  If you didn't know this place was there, you could walk right past it. Don't get discourage when you walk in this small restaurant and see a long line.  The line generally goes fast.  Plus, all of the food is cooked to order so it's nice and fresh unlike a "fast food" restaurant couple of stores away (McDonalds).   I have found, it's easier to order on line and then just go and pick it up.  There are very limited stools to sit at.  This is more of a place to order and go. The food has always been fresh and not greasy.  The staff is very friendly and helpful. Highly recommend this place.

All the positive reviews you will read are true. Being somewhat close to NYC I thought I knew my way around a hot dogs. Everything I thought I knew has been changed. Chicago you own the hot dog! I loved your dog so much I'm ready to throw down in a dark alley and fight for your honor, integrity, and superior deliciousness!!!! Keep in mind you may take me down and that will be okay. Taking a beating defending the Chicago hot dog will be worth it!

Skip McD's and American Dog, you can go to Max's and get both at lower prices. Consistently delicious burgers and Chicago style hot dogs. Great pizza puffs. And within striking range of the el and underground lines!

Perfect burger place, hole in the wall, amazing burgers, perfect fries, even the veggie burgers are amazing. Nice staff, tasty food, great environment. Not a place concerned with what's fashionable, you won't find salad greens or boasts about organic this and grass fed that, just a solid greasy spoon type place that's sure to leave you satisfied.
Great food, cheap, delivery.  It makes living in the loop bearable.   My 7 year old nephew had decided that Max's cheese burger is better than his previous favorite, Portillo's.
Amazing burgers!!  I would come here everyday  for lunch but I don't think my waistline would be too happy about it :(  So I save this little treasure for treat days :)  See you soon Max

Great food and so cheap! Fast service and my meal wasn't even $7 for Chicago dog, French fries, and a fountain Coke! My boyfriend got the Gyro burger and absolutely loved it. Much better alternative over McDonald's for a quick bite just off Magnificent Mile.

Today I went back to Max's.  My order was placed online for 1pm, we walked in at 1pm and that order was ready, hot and fresh.  Double Char burger with fries.  The fries could not be any more perfect.  No funky oil taste, no seasonings, just a beautifully crisp potato all warm and potaoey inside.  The burger was, again, beyond perfection.  Perfect cheat meal!  GO!  Two Double Chars with fries $14.75 - great price for the Loop.

A whole in the wall, no frills type of joint. The classic Chicago style hot dog was delicious. I'm not a huge pickle fan but I loved the mixture of the sausage, mustard, relish, celery salt, tomatoes, and sport peppers.  I am by no means a Chicago hot dog expert but Max's certainly set the bar high for future hot dogs!

Walking by in Chicago, saw maxs. Haven't ever been here before. If u ever go to chicago, I suggest going here. We got the Chicago dog and the double cheeseburger. Both were outstanding. We will come back.
Absolutely lived up to expectations. Visiting from Boston and needed to try a Chicago dog. I got the polish sausage and it was excellent here. Exactly what I was looking for
I loved this place!!  I came to Chicago wanting authentic food and I found it!  I had the gyro and it was delicious!  Great vibe.  Great food.  What more can you ask for??

Max's take out was a tasty little hole in the wall, downtown. I ordered 2 hot dogs since the first was so good. The only thing that I wish they had was poppy seed buns. That would make them fantastic.
The classic hot dog here with everything on it was just OK. It's not something I'd eat again.
I almost go there every friday, very tasty double cheese burger with fries and if I'm really hungry I buy a hot dog with it  ! toooo good, mind blasting!  and very reasonable price.

Not sure what all the hype is about, got a regular Chicago dog here on my way to work and it was over $5, not worth it. The guy didn't wash his hands or wear gloves-- I should've said something, it was kind of nasty.

Today I needed to find  a legit Chicago Hot Dog in the Loop. I went to Max's Take Out for the first time and loved it! The price was a bit high, but the dog and fries were pretty damn good. I hear they have good burgers too, so I'll definitely be back!

I love this place they got gyro burgers like killers so get ready for a big juicy burger. Cheese burger is tasty but not as big as gyros. I rate this place four stars because of the small space filled with food odor and there is not much space to sit and eat..of you can take out burgers it's just great

I was quite satisified with my Maxwell Polish dog and my double cheeseburger. First time to try a Chicago hotdog and I found it to be quite delicious. I didn't ask for any ketchup although I am a bit curious as to whether it would have tasted better with it (sorry Chicagoans, please don't hurt me for saying it). I'm glad I ordered it online too, because the workers there seemed a bit overwhelmed with remembering people's orders.
THE Best beef sandwich in the city!  So good!  The place is small but the line moves, the guys working know what there doing and keep it moving.  Vienna Products which of course, we love!

It's in downtown Chicago and I was in the area so I thought  I would give it a try. I had a cheeseburger and fries. The burger was very good, but a little too greasy for my liking. The fries were thick cut and were very delicious. There are a decent amount of beggars in the area and it took away from the experience when someone came in and demanded I buy him food and then proceeded to threaten me. Otherwise, it's a good place to check out if you are nearby.
First time getting a Chicago dog ever! It was everything I wanted, expected, and more! I would suggest everything to try!
Gots to love their succulent beef burger patties!!! They also have halal burgers/hotdogs available, just ask for their halal menu and enjoy :)

Man oh man. Wanna talk about a place with good food and not gouging you city style?  Max's does the trick. They have great double burgers. Chili cheese fries to die for.  I will say the hot dogs taste like they were microwaved rather than boiled in hot water which gives it that rubbery taste when you might into it.  If you want a rather cheap meal delivered and a tasty one at that. I highly recommend this place. Delicious!!!
Fast. Friendly. CHEAP. DELICIOUS. Amazing service and food on the go.
