What can I say......   A giant gyro cheeseburger, hot and fresh and a nice bun.  Gonna have to try more food but if the burger was a sample it oughts be great.  Oh - did I mention cheap?  Cheap price quality product.

Halal! Their entire menu is available in the halal version. I love this place :) I had the gyro cheeseburger and SO had the grilled chicken sandwich with a regular cheeseburger. And we had fries...omg so freaking yummy. *drool* The grilled chicken sandwich was juicy and tender...usually grilled chicken sandwiches tend to be dry. The pretzel bun is it? Omg it's to die for. Absolutely love this place.

Don't know whether cause I was too hungry or what, this double cheese burger combo makes me give Max's a  five star! Burger is so good! Fries as well! Thanks Max's so much for the good food in this cold weather. I'm definitely coming back to try the hot dogs and other stuff.
My co-workers and I stopped by for lunch. It's very small and filled up very fast. The employees were very quick and courteous, but be ready to hustle.
Only had their hotdog when I went. Hotdog is delicious and Id say it can compete well against other chicago hotdog joints. Price is good too so well worth it to try.

So having been here again I want to clarify one thing from my previous review.... although this place is 'partial halal' keep in mind they may or may not cook the food separately. This is per the workers. I enjoyed the food here but I guess it depends what matters to you most. Unfortunately for me I won't be going back for that reason alone.
One of my favorite hotdog/burger joints in the city! The food is great, staff is friendly, and the owner, Max, is one of the nicest people I've encountered. I also love that deliver!

We went here this past Sunday for a quick meal before we left town and it was quick and good!  I had pasta with sauce and I decided to add chili because I love a good chili mac and this did not disappoint!  My husband had a burger and fries which he also enjoyed.   We stayed at the JW Marriott just down the street so the location is perfect for someone trying to get something quick before they head out.  I gave a 4/5 stars because it could be a tad cleaner in there, other than that a solid place.

Tiny place but good to just stop in and get a Chicago dog on the go.  *the employees don't use gloves* I definitely don't consider myself a hypochondriac but I was a bit sleeved out to see the guy who was preparing my order grab the tomatoes and pickle with his bare hands. Don't get my wrong, I still ate it, and it was fine, but I wouldn't come back here. There are simply too many more good options in this city.
Their Gyro burger was the BEST burger I've ever had in my life. My husbands polish dog was okay, nothing special about it.  But that burger...*drool*

This place is a total dive, but has pretty tasty food. Stopped in around 6 pm on a snowy day. We were the only customers. The place didn't look very clean, but we wanted to experience a Chicago hot dog and were told this was the place to do it. The person who took our order was less than friendly, but the food was made carefully and was fresh. I don't know that I'm in love with Chicago dogs now, but it was good. Why three stars? As we sat and ate, two female workers and a friend standing at the counter starting talking about going into labor in detail. One was saying how they stuck "a stick in her to break her water and it went all over her." Very inappropriate conversation around people who are eating.

This place has great Chicago Hot dogs, at low prices, in spite of his central location within the Loop.  Quick service, friendly guys behind the counter and that hot dog, in its simplicity being...a hot dog, was very tasty with the spicy peppers kicking flavor here and there.  You order it with everything, Chicago style. Nice stop for a quick, cheap and tasty bite in downtown Chicago.

Had one of those Hotdog cravings that threaten to usurp any free will or attention span that you might need to conduct the rest of your day. I saw America's Dog, and having no particular fondness for the Lincoln Park location, I decided to forego that particular meatery in lieu of a more humble option. I spotted Max's and made a beeline. You feel like you're walking down a bowling lane as you approach the cashier, with those waiting to order on the left, and those waiting to pick up on your right. A standing room counter adorns most of the store's perimeter, but I can not remember if there were any stools. I ordered the pastrami dog and a soda. $6.12. Not outrageous, but hardly the best value in town(although maybe the best value in this part of town). The guy seems a little miffed that I wasn't doing fries for another two bucks, but wasn't outwardly rude. The pastrami was delicious and moist, the Dijon sauce was delectable, the bun was steamed as I prefer, and the 1/8 lb. hotdog's casing had a snap to it that reminded me more of a Nathan's sausage than a Vienna beef product -- despite the endless Chicago hotdog regalia that litters the walls. The portions were considerable without bordering on the absurd. The dog was great, the price was meh, and the service was adequate but hardly gregarious. No huge complaints, I'll probably come back again, but I am not converted to diehard status yet.

The hot dogs we had were tasty, but the service was atrocious. We walk in and the girl behind the counter just stood there, not at the register, but behind the counter, and scowled at us. Finally we asked if we could place an order and she still didn't respond so we just asked for two Chicago style hot dogs and then she sauntered up to the counter to write it down and even then we had to repeat the order two more times (seriously, two Chicago dogs, not a difficult order). This place would be worth more stars if the service had been, well, anything close to actual service, but honestly you can find a comparably good Chicago dog at places with a better atmosphere.

I needed to grab a quick bite in the loop on a Saturday, and I'd come to learn of this narrow spot on Adams a couple of blocks from the Art Institute. I'd read enough about it to know exactly what to expect - a decent sandwich at a fair price in a no-frills eatery. The cheeseburgers here get a lot of acclaim, but I've heard (thanks Serious Eats Chicago) that the gyro cheeseburger should be given a look. I'm glad I gave it a try, because it had that special combination of qualities that I value--delicious and freaking huge. I'm glad I had the restraint to skip the fries this time. There was truly no need after eating the GCB. My usual goto loop lunch spot is the Oasis Cafe on Wabash, but if I'm in the mood for a burger, this is the one for me.

Honestly, this place has really solid food for looking kinda run-down.  Everything I've tried has been really good quality, made-to-order food.  Tastes like a family cook-out on 4th of july.  Would definitely recommend for a delicious quick lunch.

Anytime I need a hot dog break from work, I will pop into Max's.  Decent prices for the inner city, and fast service.  Glad I stumbled upon Max's.  If I lived in the area, I would stumble into it late night for fries.  Its your quintessential Chicago area hot dog joint.

Yes, this might be one of the top 5 halal burger joints in town. Though seating can be limited especially after Jumma it's def worth it. They are halal, I know ppl always speculate but they were at the halal food festival at Uic so I'm sure a background check was done.   The one reason I like coming here more than coast burger (halal place at the nordstrom mall) is because their fries are much better.  I wasn't a fan of the chicken burger but if you want that go to jubranos. If you want a great burger with fries go to maxs

I was craving Italian Beef. Rather than go to the obvious (tourist haven) place, I used Yelp to find another option for me. Thankfully, Max's Take Out was around the corner from where I was staying. All I ordered with an Italian Beef with sweet peppers. It was so delicious! May I dare to say I enjoyed it more than where I initially wanted to go? The place is small and there is very little room to sit but don't let that deter you from going!

stopped in for a chicago style hotdog.  i was just visiting chicago and had never had one before.  so sorry chicagoans, not sure what you like about this hotdog.  its ok, but nothing to write home about.  it must be one of those you-have-to-be-from-here-to-like-it kind of things.  that and italian beef sandwiches.   *shrug*  i must just not get it.  give me a hotdog with onions any day.

This hole in the wall is what makes it a great Chicago takeout joint. You walk in and you think eh, could look classier. Then you order your food and someone shouts to the cook in the back instead of punching in the order somewhere. They seem to cook fries every few minutes so you're never getting old or flimsy fries.  I got the Italian beef last time and it's my favorite in the loop. I couldn't get over how amazing it was with mozzarella cheese and hot peppers. They stuff everything into a brown bag, authenticity of "hey this is proper Chicago food". You'll be back since their menu is huge and caters to many people.

Love this place! You walk into a no frill, divey place and they will ask you what you want about as soon as you step forward. I love the double cheeseburger combo and their chicago style hotdogs. There aren't a million options but they seem to have some more experimental fusions of things like the gyro burger. Quick and dirty in the best way.

One of the BEST HALAL cheeseburgers in the city. Make sure you ask them to make it spicy. I'm always on the hunt for a really great halal burger so I've had everything from Zak's to Indi Burger but this one hits the spot.  It's a hole in the wall kind of place, so don't plan on dining in, you might get turned off by the setting.  So far I've had the spicy cheeseburger, LOVED it. I've had the chicken burger, kind of bland for my palate, but I'm also Indian so I like my food spicy. The gyros cheeseburger was a fav among the guys, the more meat the better! And the prices are just right!
Awesome place to stop at for a quick bite.  This place is a hidden gem and the people are always are so friendly, I'll be back many more times!

So, I saw that they had a decent yelp review, and gave them a try....  Im a big grub hubber!! ordered the gyros and the spicy chicken sandwich... DISGUSTING!  note...  i had no sauce with the gyros,  the fries were cold... and the chicken sandwich was not edible....          I think some folks are figuring out a way to push the yelp #'s up.... well this should balance the scale for now... never will order here again
A three because the burger bun was very stale. Everything else was good. Also ordered chili cheese fries and jumbo dog which was great.

So sad.  I was looking forward to trying the famous Chicago dog!  Was going to originally get it elsewhere, but I was at the Art Institute and found this place on Yelp.   Came in and all 5 (or so) barstools were taken so I decided to take it to go and eat at Millennium Park.  I ordered the Chicago dog and it came out quickly.  Service was efficient.  I was so excited to take a bite into the Chicago dog and was really underwhelmed.  I took a bite of it with all the fixings (pickle, tomato, hot peppers) to be able to experience it in its entirety and was extra hungry that day and it didn't do anything for me. I was still hungry and I actually kind of regretted ordering it.  Perhaps I needed to order something else here at Max's.

The food was over priced for the rest of chicago, but about right for the loop. The gyros was not fresh cut off the roast. It was pre cut some time before. It was dry and it was cold. They were reheating it on the flat top.  The place gives you a scummy feeling. I was waiting for the bugs to crawl over my toes.

On our first trip to Chicago, a lot of friends recommended to us that we should try a hot dog in Chicago; and so we did. On our last day, we Yelped hot dogs and came across Max's Take Out which was near the hotel we were staying at so we stopped by for lunch.  The place is small, with a counter and bar stools along the left side of the place. The food came out fairly quickly. One word about their hot dogs: messy. Chicago hot dogs consists of so many toppings (the sausage, bun, mustard, onions, relish, tomato, celery salt, pickle, and peppers.... I hope I mentioned all of the ingredients) that it was difficult for me to eat without it falling apart and I'm not really a fan of messy food. One thing about Chicago: they have a strong opinion against the use of ketchup on hot dogs and because of that, I thought that I would love it. It was just good despite the fact that Chicago hot dogs use mustard and pickles on their hot dogs (which, by the way, are two of my favorites that my family and friends here in California think I'm such a weirdo for refusing to eat my hot dogs with ketchup and using mustard instead like Chicagoans).  Will I come back? Maybe.... if I mastered the art of eating a Chicago hot dog correctly and maybe I'll appreciate the hot dog more. Until then, I'll stick to my simple hot dog with yellow mustard.

One of my favorite fast foods is the classic Italian Beef sandwich, Chicago style. Usually it is because this is the one item that I am less likely to attempt to duplicate at home - so it's become a must have in lieu of burgers while I'm out. I stumbled upon this place while walking to an event and was surprised I hadn't been there yet. I knew I'd passed by ... but guess I'd always wound up at Al's for some reason. The staff was friendly and also protective over customers from solicitors. While I feel for these people, I don't appreciate being approached while I'm in the store. Anyhoo - I ordered me an Italian Beef and some fries. Fresh and delicious, perfectly prepared. For around $9 I got a little trip to heaven, before confronting the mean streets of downtown Chicago! Well worth it. I'll be back again, for sure.

Gyro Cheeseburger FTW! You get exactly what you pay for here, classic Chicago style eats! It's surprisingly difficult to find something that is different than Corner Bakery, McDonald's, Jimmy Johns, or Subway in the Loop. You def. have to at least walk over to Michigan Ave. for a better selection. After they closed down the Al's Beef off Jackson, I decided to give Max's a try for my greasy fix. I had the gyro cheeseburger and it was phenomenal. It was def. the best of both worlds. If you work in the Loop and you want something quick. you should def. try Max's Take Out!

While writing my review for another Chicago hot dog place, I really worked myself up an appetite for another delicious Chicago Style hotdog.  It just so happens that it was around lunch time so I searched for places around my office that might make these fine delicacies.  Sure enough, Max's Take Out had the answer and it looked very promising from the Yelp reviews.  When I got there, I was instantly able to tell that this was a successful endeavor - the line was long(meaning many like it) and it was moving fast.  I only wanted a hot-dog but then after seeing so many other things on the menu I decided to order a burger as well.  I know I know, my heart hates me right now! But in all honesty it's worth the high cholesterol bump.  The hot dog was legendary and even better than the one I had at another location.  The Burger was scrumptious.  I could have ordered more food.  But decided to wait until the next day to try Max's.  Very nice employees too.
I was impressed, the italian beef was perfect, especially because of the delicious bun and sweet peppers.  thank you for a delicious unhealthy meal.
Had to talk my buddies into eating here. They all walked out thanking me and declaring it the best burger & dogs they've ever had.

Umm umm good!  Had a cheap and delish Chicago style hot dog.  Good place to grab a dog and head to Grant or Millennium Park (there's only 5 bar stools in this place) if you on or near the S. Michigan Avenue area.
My first Chicago hotdog and it was delicious!! Perfect balance of tomato, pickle and celery salt! My friend and I shared the chili cheese fries and it was a win all around! I highly recommend it!
This little hole in the wall makes me smile. I love the greasy spoon
Best service ever~ in and out.  Great food. Owner and his staff works in nysnc which makes service smooth & fast. Good burger~hot dog~ gyro place in loop

Found Max's totally by accident while I was staying at the Palmer House Hilton, and it was quite possibly one of the best finds I've had in a while. A little bit of backstory, I was in town for some college auditions and desperately needed to find food that wasn't going to cost me an arm and a leg. I'd never been to Chicago before and honestly had no real experience with a proper Chicago hot dog, but figured, well, when in Rome... Which accidentally led me to Max's. I have a ridiculous fondness for hole-in-the-wall food spots. Nothing against highly starred, upscale restaurants or anything, but some of the best food I've ever found came from tiny lunch spots. I ended up getting the Polish with everything and a side of fries. The fries were previously frozen, standard greasy spoon fries, but nobody goes to places like this for  fries. The Polish, on the other hand, was fantastic. Plump, juicy, and everything you could possibly want in a hot dog.  I'm definitely keeping Max's in mind for the next time I'm in town (though, after reading all the other reviews, I may have to get a burger next time instead).

Taste [5/5] By far if your a burger consumer, you need to put this on your list. This takes classic, diner food to a new level, they changed out the bun for a new roll and overall changed the burger make (for the better).  Price [4/5]  Around $8-10 per meal, pretty typical for the chicago loop.

When you're in Chicago, you need to try the Chicago style hot dogs. That's what we did.  After a previous night of indulging in fine dining and the wine paring, the best breakfast to get over the slight hang-over was some basic good old non-pretencious local style food. By that, I mean the hot dogs in Max's.  We walked over to Max's from our hotel. The outside of this place looks low-key. The inside of the small place is pretty basic as well. However, we know we came to the right place for Chicago style hot dogs when the people there were all local folks, no tourists like us.  The staff there were friendly. Our hot dogs were prepared in no time. We ate standing by the bar just like the locals did. What a great experience.  We had the genuinely simple but good hot dogs - no catchup. :) We were happy and satisfied.

Had a groupon for 2 meals. Was hungry. Had no companion. Got two things: cheeseburger and spicy chicken. I loved the cheeseburger. Was hoping for a Wendy's type spciy chicken and got a grilled breast covered in some sort of non-spicy tomato sauce. Not a fan. So I only had a meal for one, which was fine by me. Among sketchy people in a hole in the wall place. Looked clean enough, but I wondered. No regrets coming here and the food sat well in my stomach. If I worked on its block, I could see myself coming here a lot for a cheap and good burger, but since I don't, I won't.

I'm always excited to try hole in the wall places when I am traveling. And since I'm in Chicago, I had to have an authentic chicago dog. After a quick search on yelp, I found this place just around the corner from my hotel. The best word for my experience was underwhelming. The chicago dog had no snap nor bite. I really couldn't taste the hot peppers. I didn't even know relish was there until I looked inside.  I also ordered the hot wings and spicy gyro based on some of the reviews. The wings were flat and greasy. There was a pool of grease on the bottom of the container when I opened it. It wasn't "hot" at all. The gyro was bland and dry. Maybe my experience isn't the norm...but I'll definitely look elsewhere next time I want a chicago dog.

Max's is a hole in the wall, but they have fabulous hot dogs.   I ordered a couple of regular hot dogs with everything, and they put it together just like a Chicago-style dog should be built.  All of the ingredients were fresh, and they did not make me wait around.   It is kind of a pit inside, so only four stars, but if you are downtown and need a dog, Max's can't be beat!

I walked by it twice this place is so tiny (and thus very little dining space). However, it makes up for it in big taste. I split a classic Chicago dog, Polish sausage, and some fries. Sure hit the spot. Just a few minutes from the Art Institute, a great place to get a cheap and taste meal. Avoid the chain restaurants or the fancy dining in the Art Institute and eat here!

My go to place for a classic burger in the city. Close to DePaul Loop Campus and off the CTA Brown/Green/Red Lines which is nice and accessible. Cheeseburger and Gyro burger are amazing. Two mouth watering patties with cheese. I think what makes this burger so special is the bun. It has a sweet honey like taste that compliments the meat, lettuce, onions, tomatoes, and the condiments. The bun is not too doughy but not too light and fluffy. The consistency is just pure splendid perfection. Max's Take Out is just a great place to grab a quick eat and enjoy some great city life experience. A thumb up for the the Cheese burger
Wow -- what great service!  The owner is friendly, remembers your name, cooks your delicious & inexpensive Chicago-style fast food with a smile.  A great place to stop for a quick bite.

Awesome little hole in the wall. I live just around the corner and decided to check out Max's due to the reviews here on Yelp. I was not disappointed. My wife and I decided to order online wich was very easy. Only reason they did not get 5 stars was because they had just started my order when I got there according to the time the website gave me. But they apologized and made sure my order was top priority (they were very very busy at the time). The food was excellent. The burger was great, I especially liked the bun they were on. Definitely recommend checking them out!

The best part is they have a separate Halal menu, you just have to ask.   After a long day at the museum I took my sons for a quick bite. They never had a true Chicago style hot dog, one bite and they were hooked. Great place for a  novice to start.

Very solid and reasonably priced lunch spot.  I had the gyro cheeseburger and I was impressed.  The gyro meat was flavorful and moist, but it did overtake the burger flavors a little.  The tzatziki served on the side was good, but I could have used more of it.  The bun on the burger is out of the world.  I would order just the gyro meat on the bun if I could because that bun is something special.  I'm sure they get it form a local bakery, but they've done a good procurement there.  The fried were also surprisingly good.  I think they are a generic pre-bagged variety, but they are cooked and salted perfectly to a golden brown delicious crispiness.  This place is my guilty pleasure lunch spot.

Quick, tasty food! I had the gyro burger and it was huge! A double patty and gyro meat. Also tried the chicago jumbo dog with everything. A little small for a jumbo, but the toppings were all good. If I'm here again, probably will stop in again.

I came here one day because I had a groupon, if not for that I never would have even noticed the place. But I am soooooo thankful that I did. I ordered a hamburger for myself and a hot dog for my roommate. Being that I had never tried their hotdog, I cut a small piece off to just sample it. ILong story short i ended up eating the burget and hotdog and probably less than 5 minutes because it was that good!   Even without a groupon, the food is cheap and delicious!
A real hole in the wall, but not bad for burgers, fries and chicago style dogs. Though I'm not sure they actually use Vienna Beef... No poppy seeds on the buns = suspicious! ;)
Dogs were good.  Same as you'd get at any other hot dog joint.  Atmosphere and service were fine.

3.5 stars.  Had it not been for Groupon, I probably would have walked past Max's a hundred times without ever noticing it.  This place is real small, cramped as can be and not at all inviting.  But the food here is mighty good by fast food standards.  Another plus is they have a separate halal menu for burgers, chicken, and gyro.  A quick run-down of menu items that we tried: Spicy chicken sandwich - juicy grilled chicken and sauce was very tasty. my favorite sandwich here.   Double cheeseburger - meh. with their thin, tasteless patties these are smaller than some single cheeseburgers.   Gyro - quite good.  they give you a generous amount and it's not as greasy as other places Hot wings - very good but hardly sauce any sauce on the wings  Fries - amazing!  fresh fried and perfectly crispy Service is quite efficient, despite only two guys working there.  Food is made fresh and ready within 10 mins.  Tip for Groupon users, make sure you mention your Groupon when ordering because some of the sandwiches and sides are not part of the deal even though it's not explicitly stated.  You can still get them though, just will have to pay a $1 extra per item.

My dad was in town and we were looking for a good cheap place to get a cheeseburger somewhere besides McDonald's. I saw this place on yelp and told him we should try. Both of us were very impressed. Everybody is really speedy and the burgs and fries and great! You can't go wrong with the price either. Looking forward to another Groupon and I plan to join the rewards.

Just FYI - no bathroom, 9 bar style seats, that's it. To be expected. Food is amazing. Get the gyro burger if it is available, simple delicious. Good patty, american cheese, gyro meat, tzatziki sauce, and a old fashioned pretzel bread bun. Not your run of the mill burger joint! I was so full that I couldn't finish my polish dog until way later when it was cold, but it tasted pretty good then too.

Decent spot for a quick lunch with no frills and probably no crowds around. Quick service from order to food less than 2-3 mins. Had the italian beef sandwich with hots, which was solid in terms of bread, decent amount of beef, and nice hot peppers. Wish they had dipped it more in the au jus...not as good as portillos but that's to be expected. Co workers had chicago-style hot dogs and both enjoyed it. Really good fries.  Quick and dirty. Solid place for some lunch without the lines.
Great Chicago polish dog!  Big slice of pickle, mustard, peppers, and thick tomato slices make it great.  It's a hot dog, yeah, but a really great hot dog if that's what you're in the mood for.
Perfect spot to try a Chicago style dog. Just enough counter space to grab a stool or stand and chow down then get out to make room for the next customer. Good prices, good dogs.

People are friendly. I had the spicey gyros sandwhich my first time there. Also, their Royalty Rewards program is great. You get point for buying food, doing surveys, and you get a $3.00 coupon in the mail. Highly recommend for fast, good food.

Now, I have seen Max's for many years but I never went in although it always seemed to be very busy. Well, they were on Groupon and my friend had a coupon from Groupon which made our meal free so how could we not jump on that deal! Free or not I wouldn't go back because I still don't get these finger thin Hot Dogs piled with pickles, tomatoes, onions and mustard!  There is more veggies then it is meat and that just doesn't impress me at all! We both asked for a cup of water and we were only given one cup for two girls and when we tried to get another one the guy behind the counter ignored us and that right there made me not want to come back either...Can we say rude? The fries were okay not as good as some but better than some others! I don't knock the people who like these style of Hot Dogs but I just don't I prefer my Hot Dog to be thick and filled with flavor like my favorite Hot Dog and Hamburger place Reggie's!

This is my favorite place for a hot dog in Chicago. Small small place but great dogs! Perfect buns! Topped just right. Delicious Vienna beef dogs. Quick service!  Highly recommend for hot dogs! Their burgers are delicious too.

I love this place for what it is. Cheap, greasy delicious food. Ordered for delivery twice and food was great both times and delivered by who I think may be the owner - a very friendly guy. This will continue to be a go to spot for me.  The burger is delicious-thin patties but great char flavor.  Gyro, although it came a little dry, made up in flavor and tzatziki.  I, for one, like the cheese sauce with the fries a la portillos.  Pizza puff is a guilty pleasure and at 2.70, a steal.  Order from here, you won't regret it.

I was not as impressed by their hot dogs the first time I ate there, but that's because I've been spoiled elsewhere. Let me tell you, if you've never tried a gyro burger before then you're missing out. I just finished eating one and felt compelled to review it. That's how good it was. The meat and bun were soft and perfect together. Not too much onion, but enough to give it some added flavor. This has become a favorite for me. Definitely give it a try if you're in the neighborhood.

Hit this place right off the train from Midway before reporting to my customer. Trips to Chicago always carry some pressure to choose well at every meal. I had the classic Chicago dog. The dog was natural-casing and delicious. The celery salt was prevalent and more noticeable (in a good way) than I'm accustomed to. No poppy seeds on the bun, but they weren't particularly missed. Despite waltzing in at 12:15, service was crisp and efficient. My colleague and I scored seats at the side counter (it seats maybe 8-10). If the weather hadn't been gorgeous, it probably wouldn't have worked out. Dozens of people were in and out while we were eating. As I said, they're efficient here.

Number 1 it is so hard to find Halal American food.  Look no further Max's has delicious double cheese burgers , gyro's and chicken that is all Halal.  The food is made in a timely manner and reasonably priced.  Whenever I am in the downtown area I visit.

another quick lunch. Very small place so you may miss it if you are not lookign for it. Had the gyro burger.  good flavors, bun was soft but not soggy like some other reviewer said.  would probably come back for their other food - as some reviewers saying they have a great chicago dog. 4 stars because good and i would come back!

It feels like Chicago. It tastes like Chicago. It's small as heck, the line is moderate during office rush hour, but it's so, so good. Wasn't soggy; wasn't bad--just good old, unhealthy office take out.
Best damn beef sandwich I ever had.  It was so good I returned two days later for an encore - which was just as tasty.  Max's rocks!

I'm so glad someone showed me this hole in the wall, otherwise I would have never noticed it. This place is good for people that work/go to school in the loop and need to quickly grab-a-bite. Since it is a hole in the wall there are only 5-6 seats so I wouldn't plan on eating there. Plan on taking it elsewhere whether it's back to the office or head over to the garden next to the museum. This place isn't for anyone who is health conscious as this place is the epitome of a grease-spot. It's not good unless the grease is coming through the brown bag, right? I have a had several things here and I have never been disappointed. In my opinion their gyros are super yummy. You can actually see the meat on the vertical spit in the kitchen, so it's not that nasty pre-sliced/pre-formed meat.

Really frickin cheap solid Chicago style dogs. Beef sandos and pasta to boot but I was only interested in a snack. Got a dog fully loaded. walked over to the Art Institute gardens and had a leisurely munch before dinner. The guy working the counter seemed a bit cranky but maybe that's the way he is? fast, tasty snack for not too much moola

Great dogs and gyros... never tried the burgers but they don't look half bad. Decent price and quick service despite the seemingly daunting line that forms during lunch hours.  The place is kind of small though so it might be tough to grab a seat when it's busy.  Definitely a place to come back to if I'm ever craving greasey fare.

Had the gyro and Chicago styled dog.  Both were very good and was worth the trip.  Is it the best in town?  I wouldn't say that.  But if you are close by and want a solid gyro or dog, this is a good place to go.

Read other reviews so thought I'd give it a shot. Glad I did. Fries are thin and crispy and very good. Nice burger w exceptional bun for a carry out joint. Brewed tea is nice touch. Look forward to going back.

I found this little hole in the wall in walking distance from my job one day with a strong craving for a cheeseburger. I ordered a cheeseburger and cheese fries for about 7 bucks, and unless it was my extreme craving speaking, it was really good. I didn't expect it to be that fresh because I seen the cook pull out the meat and it was prepattied and frozen. At that point though my card had been swiped. The only thing that bothers me about this place is that THEY WERENT WEARING ANY GLOVES!! Whyyyyy?! I am borderline germaphobic so this bothers the hell out of me. Only thing that saved it was that I seen the cook wash his hands, otherwise it wouldve been a true no go. Please Max's Take Out, if you read these reviews, invest in some gloves for the cooks. I would have given one more star had I seen some gloves on some hands.

Want to know what's a turn off? A soggy bun. I can see why Chicagoans eschew ketchup. I would rather have pickles, peppers, celery salt, sliced tomatoes and more on my hot dog than ketchup. I definitely needed those accompaniments to add flavor to this dog and bun combo. Overall, and I'm rating this experience to other dog experiences and not just Chicago style, I must say that Chicago style isn't for me. I want that dog to pop, have some zing, some flavor. Sorry, but I'm not a fan. I did enjoy their fast service and the fact they're working with a couple different apps to enhance their customer service and loyalty.
Best emmer effing take out on The Loop.   Love that wing sauce.

I tried Max's after hearing good things about it from my co-workers. I was looking for an alternative to McDonalds but sadly I was left wishing that I'd followed my first mind. I ordered a hotdog and fries and while it wasn't horrible, I can't say it was all that great either. It was simply just fair but for nearly $8 I think they need to do a heck of a lot better than that!! The fries weren't hot and didnt appear to be the freshest potatoes in the bunch either. Didn't matter anyway though because they weren't all that tasty either. The dog was just okay and the Coke didn't really taste like Coke. I actually think it might have been a substitute because I am a Coke-alholic and I know what they gave me wasn't Coke! Or was it the fact that my cup had been filled with another beverage before the dude at the counter poured it, rinsed it (barely) and filled it with my beverage?? I was a little taken aback by that but who am I to think that a hole-in-the-wall joint should have standards?? I wouldn't say not to give this place a try but I won't be back.

Yummm! Though I'd had a Chicago dog before, I was starving after exploring the Science & Industry museum so I had to stop in with a few girlfriends on the way back to our hotel.  It looks a little shady, but the people are super friendly! The food comes out quick and it's cheap- what more can you ask for? I got a polish dog with chili (unconventional, I know... but I was really craving some chili :/) and it was soooo good. Everyone else enjoyed their hot dogs and cheese fries and were super stuffed for the next few hours on just a couple bucks so no complaints here :)

When we stopped in it was empty, but looked well worn as if it gets lots of business. The girl at the counter was really helpful and the food was ready fast and hot! The Spicy gyro was decently spicy, but not Indian hot or anything crazy. I like crazy hot food, but it was okay. The chili cheese fries were as awesome as anything I've had and my partner really enjoyed her dog and fries. Close to our stay at the Silversmith and well worth the stroll. By the time we ate and left the line was out the door and the place was packed. A very good sign.

They changed their burger buns and I am a fan. Oh god how I am a fan. I'm addicted to their gyro cheeseburgers. It's kinda too much but hey, I'm a gal that likes sickeningly over the top indulgence when it comes to food and by golly when you put gyro meat on top of a cheeseburger and add some of the most golden crispy fries that is exactly what you get. Whew, I have to go take a cold shower or something because Max's is fast food/take out that just turns me onnnnnn

I'm actually confused at all the ratings and the proclamations that this is the best Chicago-Style dog. I would say that Portillo is better and cheaper! The hot dog was okay. It's cheap and tasty, but the toppings felt really ordinary. It tasted as if you went into your fridge and got out the typical things to put on a chicago dog and them just used them. It wasn't special by any means.
Awesome Italian beef sandwich! Just perfect take out place that serves hot dogs, burgers, and other sandwiches. Extra star for server who sounded straight out of the Ditka skit from SNL.

Ok maybe the whole Chicago dog and the yelp community hyped this place up a little too much.  I was in Chicago on a 4days vacation, I tried the Chicago dog here at Max's Take out and wasn't impress by it.  It was good but I wouldn't go out of my way to get it.

The food was amazing; one of the best hot dogs I've ever had and had it not been for the bugs flying around the restaurant and the very dirty establishment combined with the fact that the chef was grabbing ingredients with his bare hands, it would have got five stars.

I am very sad. Not because there is anything wrong with this place, but because I work in the suburbs and I can no longer visit and eat their amazing Italian beef.  I used to go at least twice a week when I was going to school down the street, but I can no longer do that. Anyway, the food is amazing, super fast service, and very cool dudes working. I give this place 5 stars because it can't possibly get anything lower. The prices are very reasonable and they have a rewards program. How awesome is that?!

Best Chicago-style dog in the city!  Nice guys, cheap prices and good cheese fries, too!  Bonus: It's quick walk from the Art Institute of Chicago, making this place extra nice for a quick bite with your touristy family/friends.

Max's Take Out was our very first meal after arriving in Chicago.  Upon arriving, I had no clue what a Chicago dog entailed so I just said, "Yes" to everything.  Little did this California boy know that it comes with mustard, peppers, a pickle, tomato, onion, relish and celery salt.   As much as I wanted to experience the complete effect of what a Chicago dog tastes like, I had to pull out the tomato, blah!  After that was done, I took my first bite and it was pretty good, but had to pull out the peppers as they were too hot and the pickle, as I wanted to eat it on the side.  We also ordered a side of fries, which were decent. The spot itself was small, narrow and only had counter seating along the wall so it's not necessarily somewhere you'd want to hang around, it's more of an eat and run spot. Overall, thanks Max's for giving me my first experience of a Chicago dog!
Had the awesome Polish dog. Came during lunch time so the line was pretty long BUT the service was quick; I was in and out less than 15 minutes. Will come again!

Sometimes a girl just needs a damn greasy double cheeseburger (everything) and fries. Something real. Something she can count on. Feel in her hands. Served brusquely in a little joint covered with a patina of filth. Yeah, don't judge me. I love that they have the LevelUp app here now, so I can pay with my phone. Retro Chicago food, paid for with the future.
normal good chicago dog, what makes this place awesome is being open late on weekends and accepting credit cards!

I've had pretty much everything thing from this place and everything is really good lol. My personal favorite is Spicy Grilled Chicken Burger with Gyros. Their wings are good and the gyros cheeseburger. Service in terms of time is pretty good. Not a long wait during peak hour.

Okay, take this review with a grain of salt. We came to this place because we wanted to get cheddar fries after having wanted to find a great cheddar fries place for months. When I say cheddar fries, I mean Wisconsin cheddar, real-cheddar-melted-on-piping-hot-fries-fries. We read on one of the reviews that this place has the best cheese fries, because they use some sort of non-nacho cheese. But... when we got there, the cheese, sure was nacho cheese. It reminded me of the type of cheese fries I had in high school, except the fries admittedly were better fried and tasted fresher. But the cheese was definitely a HUGE disappointment. If you think you're coming here to eat some quality cheddar cheese fries, don't get your hopes up. Other than that though I would have given this place four stars. The burgers were delish. My friend had the gyro burger and I had the Italian beef burger. They were both really good and they were big for the price. They really do not skimp on the meat when they build your burger. Granted I could really taste the burger itself from the marinara sauce they lathered onto my burger but I could for sure taste the mozzarella cheese, the Italian meat, and the sweet peppers I got on them. I'll probably be back but it'll have to be for the burger and fries combo, don't think I'll be needing any yellow cheese any time soon. As another Yelper says, this place is tiny. They have about 5-10 barstools and that's about it. So when it gets busy don't expect to sit down for a meal. It's relatively close to the park though, so you can always bring it there on a beautiful Spring or Summer day.
Really my only foray into Chicago dogs, but what I got was very very delicious and satisfying. Came back to try a polish dog a few days later. Would return again!

When I walked in, I felt like I was trespassing on secret local's joint. (Am I wrong? It was the vibe I got).  It felt legit, in the middle of the city.  I wasn't as impressed with the hot dog as much as Kim and Carlo's though.  Italian Beef looked okay, cod sandwich was very fried, but good for temporary vegetarians like myself. Best thing here: fries. Made very well. Cut thick, crispy on the outside, soft on the inside. yumm. Ketchup bottles for fries!

New to the neighborhood, so only tried this once. The double cheese burger was delicious. The chili cheese fries were good...the fries weren't soggy which was awesome. I am hoping the rest of the menu items are as good as the burgers and fries were!

While visiting Chicago, having a real Chicago dog was pretty high up there on my to-do list along with seeing the Bean. That being said, it was important for me to find a place that offered it the way it should be. Although it's the only dog I had while out here, my take on it was it's the goodness of a true Chicago dog w/out all the fluff and stuff. No radioactive green relish. No overbearing huge hot dog. No poppyseed bun. Just your good ol' vienna beef dog, pickle, sport peppers, tomato, onion, mustard and celery salt. The hot dog had a great snap with each bite and the blend of flavors from all the toppings mesh together perfectly with a nice tang. Seriously, no ketchup is needed because that sweetness would destroy that savory and tangy flavor. A tiny gripe is that the buns are steamed so they do fall flat after holding your dog for a while and make things a little messy. The hot dog itself may look small, but trust me, it is just right. Order some fries, they're perfectly crispy and comes in a cute little brown bag!
Gyro cheese burger, take out is pretty quick, and the location is a min away from Depaul. service is good!!!!
Hot Dog was so good thought it would be dis-respectful to put ketchup on it!

Update to my last review.. apparently they've gone all zabiha and don't serve any bacon anymore.. well they do serve turkey bacon for anyone looking for it. But this definitely helps seal the deal for zabiha eaters.. and the food's still great and is not really scrimping on flavor.

I eat here probably three to four times a week.  It is classic, classic Chicago.  If I was ever showing around a tourist and they wanted to see why we are the undisputed greasy food capital of the world, I would take them here.  The Dogs, gyros, chicken sandwiches and burgers are terrific.   I would stay away from the Italian Beef here, partially because specialty beef places do it better, but also because it's just average for a dog stand like this one, and the rest of their stuff is above the standard.   Also if you order a Polish with everything they will give you the works for a dog as opposed to the traditional grilled onions and mustard.  If you ask for it that way though, they will happily oblige.

i went there to get some Italian Beef but switched up and got a double cheeseburger instead.  it was pretty good. it had a good smokie taste to it. the guy at the counter was cool to, i told him i hadnt tasted Italian Beef and he gave me a sample and it was good as hell (nh).

This place is basically a hallway with a kitchen in the back, when I set out to find a genuine no frills local restaurant known to locals, this was the spot. The night before I had walked by the place and thought "wow, that place looks a little rough, it has to be either awful or really, really good". Fortunately, the latter was the case and I had a great Gyro and fries. There are literally only 6 bar stools type seats in the place so it's not really a sit down place, although I was solo so I sat there and ate. Staff was completely courteous and accommodating.

I love this place! it's prime location in downtown on Adams between State & Wabash. Friendly customer service, fast service, reasonable prices... Halaal burgers.. my to-go place for the perfect double cheese burger! Oh.. and their fries... yummmm!!
Best hot dogs I've ever had.

It remain me of that 1980 atmospheric.The food remains in a time long ago but current.Friendly people and great tasting hamburgers and the fries cook just right. That one place I will go back to eat again. make you feel at home.

As a visitor from California, had to stop by for an authentic chicago dog. Got the "jumbo" which wasn't all that large but had lots of fresh toppings. Also tried the italian beef sandwich which I thought had good flavor but didn't taste super hot or fresh. The french fries were excellent however - hot and crispy.  I would recommend checking them out for a quick snack and their location near the loop is convenient.

I hate hot dogs, although, since I was in Chicago, I just had to have a Chicago-styled hot dog.  Max's was mine and R's first experience of a Chicago dog. We came here during our trip and originally had wanted to go to UB Dogs (because they have that radio active green relish, from Yelp photos), but they're closed on a Saturday! :( Came here after our visit to the Willis Tower, and we were starving. We stumbled across Max's and America's Dog (across the street) as we walked to the CTA. America's Dog had that fast food chain feel, as Max's seemed to be the better choice; a hole-in-the-wall, which most tasty food comes from anyway. They didn't have the radioactive green relish we asked for, though the guy told us it was just "color." Got our hot dogs and had piping hot fries in a tiny paper bag. The vienna had a nice crunch! Not rubbery and disgusting like other hot dogs. The dog paired with the sport peppers, tomatoes, relish, celery (opted out of the pickle) was an awesome combination!  Roughly $5-6, for a hot dog meal (hot dog, fries, medium soda); It's too bad that I will refuse any other form of hot dog that comes my way, unless it's a Chicago dog!
I just went here using a Groupon (I had no idea they existed before that) and was totally surprised by how good it was - best fast food cheeseburger I've had in a long time.

My hand smells like Italian beef, which reminded me to write this review.  Why am I so gross?   Max's answered the call of my Italian beef cravings, and Living Social sweetened the deal and I saved $2.  To be honest, the beef was just alright, it wasn't as beefy as I'd hoped and was a shade on the smaller side.  It was fine, just not fabulous.  The cheese fries however, hit the spot.  It seems like they used Merkts or some type of Merkt's esque product, but whatever it was, it was not the goopy ick that many places go with.  I'd get them again, and again.   Service was friendly and extra fast, even with a Living Social instant deal.  Good work, guys.  I'll probably give some of the other menu items a try, or just eat nothing but cheesy cheesy cheese fries.
the locals eat here so you know it's good... but it didn't blow my mind though... nice place for a quick bite of chicago...

Max's has the right mix of hole-in-the-wall and Chicago-flare. I enjoyed this place better than America's Dog (across the street). Although they do not have the poppy seed buns, I felt that I did not miss that too much.  Their sport peppers have the right amount of spice and pickled tart to them. Plus the pickle is dill, just the way I like my pickles.  Overall, I'd give this place 3.5 stars but rounding up here to show that I would go back if I was craving a hot dog and I happen to be in the area. It really helps that the guys behind the counter were so nice. I felt like they took care with every hot dog that they cooked/put together...is that weird? *shrug* Yup. I think so.
Nothing fancy, just good inexpensive fast food fare. I had a regular dog with everything and polish dog with everything. Both were solid. There's a counter with maybe 8 stools.

My first taste of Chicago style hot dogs and it was DELICIOUS. The service was fast and the guy was friendly and patient with 3 tourists confusedly ordering random food. I'm craving them now as I type. I had the polish dog with everything and I highly recommend it. The chili cheese fries were great too - fresh, piping hot chili generously smothered on top of crispy fries done just right.

When I moved to Chicago I went on a mission to truly understand and appreciate its take on fast food. Now that some of the novelty has become commonplace in my daily routine, Max's Takeout still shines as a beacon of light and magic in this place I've come to call home, and they've played a good part in making it feel that way. At first it was the hotdogs. I was on a mission to find the best hotdog in the loop. As we all know, it's kind of hard to mess that up. Perhaps it was the fries that kept me coming back though. It wasn't until I tried their cheeseburger special that I knew something great was going on here. It's difficult to describe. I mean, the place is kind of a hole in the wall, but the burger's are just fantastic. The kaiser roll is fresh and soft, they don't really put anything unique on it. I think that things like this only occur when something has been done the same way for a long time. I asked the cook one time what it was that made their burgers so good and he just told me "we use good meat." I guess that must be it. Really, just go there and get the cheeseburger special next time you're in that part of the loop. The gyros are great, so is the polish, but I think the cheeseburger special is their flagship dish. It has seriously led me out of darkness on numerous occasions.
Meh, if I am going to ruin my week of good food choices for a hotdog and fries, I'll go somewhere else. It just didn't measure up to some of the other Chicago spots.
Fast and friendly service. Great deals on great dogs. Cheeseburgers are top shelf too.

SOME OF THEIR STUFF IS HALAL!!   I can't stress that enough!  I honestly couldn't believe I'd been suffering through Subways this whole time when I had an almost equidistant, halal, and far more delicious option available! I ordered the grilled chicken, it was amazing, all white meat (looked like real food!), grilled on the spot.  The fries were hot and lightly salted, average size. They were okay.  I had the Hi-C (fruit punch) and for some reason, it tasted really good. My friend ordered the double cheeseburger and requested they only use one patty instead of two.  Turns out, she shouldn't have made modifications, as the patty was pretty thin.  Service was super fast, the man behind the counter was soo nice and even the other patrons, very chivalrous. The whole place just had a very nice, "small community in a big city" feel to it. It's my new go-to place when I'm at school until 11:00 at night.

I felt so american eating here. I just went in not expecting much and really I didnt get much, just a good ol' fashioned chicago hot dog, fries, and a drink. I swear, a fountain drink has never tasted so good. Its not that the fountain drinks were that different from any other place, but the hot dog was fantastic and the coke really hit the spot when it was all said and done. The hot dog was really awesome. the tomatoes had some kind of spice on it that added that extra flavor that I couldnt getif I made them at home. Its so close to the SAIC dorms and campus that I'll most likely end up back there for lunch on multiple days of the week. Super cheap too for a big hot dog, fries and a soda. Big Ups.
$5.50 for a dog, fries, and drink in the loop.  Can't be beat.  Hot dog was very good, fries hot and crisp.   In and out in 15 mins...can't go wrong..

The customer service is always excellent. The staff is very friendly. The best part about the place is the partial halal menu. The double cheeseburger is delicious. The grilled chicken sandwich is also good. The wings are ok.  I wish they would add halal hot dogs to the menu. Then, I would be there every day for a halal Chicago style hot dog. This place is definitely worth the trip.

We were staying in the loop, and we went to Max's for breakfast.  I ordered the Chicago Dog with all the trimmings and hubby ordered the italian beef with sweet peppers.  At less than $11, this was the cheapest meal that we had in Chicago! It may seem weird ordering a Chicago Dog at 7:30 AM, but I like trying new things and there is nothing new about an egg on a muffin.  Please... The dog was tasty.  A nice crisp casing in a steamed bun with the tomatoes, relish, dill spear and sport peppers.  The steamed bun falls apart because of the liquid coming off the dog, and the relish, and the dill pickle spear.  But, it's a tasty mess. The Italian Beef was outrageous.  The meat was tender, the roll had a nice crunch, and the sweet peppers were on point.  I highly recommend it!  Hubby loved it, and I was lucky to get a bite. This place is definitely a dive, but the people running the shop are so nice.  I would have given it five stars, but there are some real characters there in the morning who don't care if they are yelling through you to talk to each other (guys - if you want to chat, please set NEXT to each other, rather than screaming through the only two available bar stools in the joint, because you have covered the other ones with your coats).  Being as the guys who run the shop definitely knew them, it would have been nice for them to say something about yelling through us to talk.  But, if you take your food to-go, you don't need to deal with it.

If it wasn't for Yelp I never would have walked into this place.  It is truly a hole in the wall street side eatery.  The hot dogs are good, but best of all it is a small business ran by some really nice people.

My friend took me here to try out their halal burgers. I was so surprised about how quickly they fulfilled our order. It was fast, fresh, and super yummy. Thank god I didn't know about this place last year otherwise I would be 20 pounds heavier! Hot dog, double char burger and gyros....SUPER YUMMY!

AWESOME Polish Dog! I'm glad my 1st time to try a Chicago dog was at Max's.  We just happened to find this, by yelp!, and because it was right next to our hotel. Love, love, love this place! Next time i'm going to try a gyro.

Since I work slavishly in the Loop, I rely on a few places for great and simple Chicago cuisine. Max's is one of those places. Generally, all I ever get is a hot dog, fries, and a drink. The food never disappoints, and I enjoy looking at the mural of the Chicago Skyline.

The best grease anyone has to offer. $5.50 for a jumbo hot dog, fries and a drink?! Yes please! My friend and I went in around 1:45 and it was relatively empty. The fries were just the right amount of crispy without being too salty. She got a cheeseburger which was pretty good, but nothing beats the hot dog. I don't even know what to say, it was just perfect! I'm going back for sure!

So you're downtown and want to feel like you're going to the place that you would never hear about unless you work/live here. Or, you're working/studying downtown and want a cheap, steady go-to every one and a while. Come on in.  If they can see you behind the counter, they'll holler at you for your order.  Don't be shy, let them know what you're having!  You want a real Chicago hot dog? Go here.  I also get Italian beefs and gyros which are right on par for this city joint. Minus 1 star for the grease! Not that I don't love it, but I'm gonna kill myself one day from eating here too much.

Chicago dog, fries, and a 21 oz drink for $5.50.  The food came about 45 seconds after I ordered it.  The Hot Dog was tasty, and the fries were great; and even the fountain drink (diet coke) tasted good.  The service was prompt, very courteous, and friendly.  Can't ask for more than good food, great service at a great price. BTW, Yelp has this place listed twice; it's also known as Max's to Go.

I come here occasionally on my lunch break for their burgers.  There aren't too many places to get a good fast burger in the loop, so this is usually me best option (although my new move is to hop the Red Line up to M Burger, eat fast, and then take the Red Line back down).  In any case, the burger is pretty good, but not great.  I'm not a big fan of the fries, but I'll keep coming back until I find a better burger within walking distance of my office.

When walking from the art institute, we stopped in here on a whim! Ended up visiting 2 more time during our 4 day stay in Chicago.  The best Chicago hot dog ever!! I got mine with cheese and everything else. the fries are super crisp and the soda is balanced.  love this place!!

Came here before a CSO Concert and it really hit the spot for Chelsa (who wanted a burger) and me (who was just hungry =P).  The food is cheap, hot and quick... Can't really ask for much more for lunch... I had the Polish with everything and was a bit surprised it came out with everything a Chicago style dog had... I guess I just expected mustard and onions... But it was still good :) It was greasy, but not so greasy that it made me feel sick.

I work a couple storefronts down from Max's, so I thought I'd give those boys a review. The staff at Max's delivers just what I'm looking for on my thirty minute lunch breaks: hot fast food made to order, under $10, in under five minutes. The fries are crispy, nicely salted and thick (like a better BK fry). The beef patties are on the thin side, but served on nice soft doughy rolls and are topped with just the right amount of sauces, onions, and a crisp leaf of iceberg lettuce. The food here may not be anything special, but it beats the stuff from similarly priced chains, and it's that guilty pleasure that makes my work week a little more bearable!
My favorite burger place in the city.  Try the gyro burger. PS - doesn't work well for "lunch dates" but remember, only God can judge you.

Hole in the wall.  Nothing special.  Got the jumbo dog with everything on it.  Just okay.  Staff was friendly and service was quick, but would only eat here if i worked in the area and needed a quick lunch.

Thank you, Thank you, Thank you! Chicago and I got off to a bad start but mid-day at the Art Institute I started craving the one goal I had for the trip: Experience the Chicago dog. Boy did I. One of my friends from home that's a Chicago native warned me to get my dog with everything or they would shun me out of whatever place I went to. I listened. Except for the Jalapenos. I'm too much of a spice wimp for that.  The dogs at Maxs' redeemed my trip and put a little umph back in my step. The relish, tomatoes, mustard gave me all the tang & balance that I was hoping for. In fact, after the 1st bite I asked myself "Why just Chicago? This should be an everywhere dog?". On the suggestion from our Chicago residing host I went with the Polish vs. the Hot Dog and got 2 rounds. There's another chain in Chicago called "Portillos" that my friend recommended but none of their locations were anywhere near where I was at the time.
A great hole in the wall. Good Italian Beef Sandwich

Dog was good , the combo was pretty cheap actually. Great pickle by the way. If you like a good pickle check this place out. Had breakfast once and it was OK. Decent prices. Good food. Quick service. In the loop. Ching-Ching baby!
Hamburgers and hot dogs.... what can I say?  Decent price.

I don't see all the fuss. It's fine for what it is. The staff are rude - which adds charm if you've an amazing restaurant equivalent of a "dive bar" but it's just not amazing. I will be back because it's very close to work and edible for the kind of food they serve

Cheap, fast, and good.  The Chicago dogs are spot-on, the polish is good, can't wait to try the Italian Beef.  Service is fast, and you can get a good lunch for around $5 bucks.  In the loop.  Not a fan of the burgers though, but everything else has been great.

Damn they're fast. For $5, hot dog filled to the brim with pickles, onions, mustard, and peppers. A side of some good fries, and a drink. It isn't the best hot dog i've ever had but for $5, this is exactly what I want for a Chicago experience.

I am so glad I work near a place like this; I'd be lost without them.  They're everything you want in a hot dog/italian beef joint.  Fast, cheap, tasty.  The chicago style dog is a fastball down the middle of the plate.  Snappy vienna dog, steamed bun, all the fixins.  It's 90% as good as my favorites around town, and given their location that's enough for me.  The italian beef is solid.  Bread is never stale, they'll dip the hell out of it the way I like it and the beef is greasy but not gross at all.  Solid giardiniera too.  Makes for a hearty mid-day gut bomb.  The cheese burger really is pretty good.  There are lots of burgers around the loop, but this is my favorite.  It's quick, grilled to order and topped with lettuce, tomato, mayo, onions, and ketchup.  American tavern-style hamburger.  Once again they're not striving for anything tremendous, it just hits the spot. The only thing keeping them from a five star is their fries.  They're ok.  They're always hot and crispy, but they have the starchy taste of frozen fries.  It wouldn't be that tough for them to cut the fries fresh and fry them while you wait.  Still they're good enough.
Great Chicago-style hotdogs, fries and prices. The burgers are not that great, though.

Since I was staying close, this was my stop for a Chicago hot dog.  I wasn't let down.  It was fast, cheap and awesome.  I wanted to go have another dog, but didn't have enough time.  I can't really compair it to any other hot dog places in the Windy City, but i was not disapointed with it.

I am not understanding the reviews of what amazing burgers are here. What? My friend and I were excited because of the reviews, we opened our orders and my friend immediately stated: "This is Burger King." I ordered a double bacon cheeseburger, the burger was barely the size of a single patty burger, just these two burnt sheets of meat hidden in a mediocre bun. The paper bacon didn't add much either. I could actually get a better burger at Burger King. The fries were apparently the same fast food quality so I guess they were adequate.  I would normally wait until I've tried something else but "beef" is in their description title when it wasn't worth mentioning.
Fast service, decent beef sandwich, lots of hot peppers.

The ultimate hot dog and burger joint.  It's fast, it's inexpensive and it is soo good. They have great lunch specials. I've only had hotdogs and burgers here, why change something you like?   When you're in the area, definitely stop by here.  You can eat at one of the stools along the counter or you can just grab it to go.  Super fast service, super good eats and super nice guys workin' there. Love it!

I honor of their crazy fast service I will be brief. I had the hot dog special (Chicago dog, fries, soda) $5 total.  Served in a New York minute.   They have about 10 or so stools there were you can eat in if you like.  which is something I wondered about when looking on line about this place. Food was yummy, & the fries were great.  Service was good for the 3 seconds I interacted with them

My friends and I wanted to try some hot dogs in Chicago.  Conveniently in downtown Chicago, we had a few and they were actually pretty good.  They make their dogs hot and fresh.  I must have been really hungry because I remember going in and buying a second one!  Were they that good or was I just that hungry?
Wonderful food in a quaint city bustling atmosphere. No better place to eat than here!

I have been in Chicago since January and understood what all the hype was about Chicago Dogs. Then i have been on a mission to find the best dog in town. Well so far I would have to say this this is up there. If you are not looking for Max's you may miss it. It is a little ducked in shop right off the street. But those are usually the places that serve the best! For me... Max's is right around the corner from work. And you can get a delicious hot dog in about 2 seconds. i will reserve my judgement to see if it is the best in town because I am still new here. But if there are dogs better than these... Im going to need to give other places more than 5 Stars! Anyone have any suggestions on other dog shops... message me! I'll investigate!

Every time I come back to Chicago this is one of my first stops.   The Italian Beef here is simply one of the best in the Loop.  I've tired the Chicago-style Hog Dog which always taste great with fresh fixings. If you're looking for simply & quick, this is your place.

This place was literally a hole in the wall. I read a few reviews and thought that the burgers may be good... I mean, I wasn't expecting Portillos but honestly I'll never go back here. I didn't like the fries and my burger was just so-so...I'd recommend Gold Coast Dogs over this place any day!!

I must say this is one of those times I'm disappointed in my yelpers!  I was extremely excited to find out that I had a top notch burger very close to my job.  I just had to try is asap.   After giving it a try yesterday, I don't know how this place came up as a high result when I typed in "burgers", but it did...it came in at 3 overall.  Now, I'm not entirely sure how those rankings are made, but this is not a top 5 burger by any means.   The burger had plenty of mustard and mayo which made the bun slide around and all the mayard (mayo and mustard blended together somehow) to slip down my hand.  I wish I knew to not get mayo cause I've been trying to cut back on things like that.  Regardless, it is just too much on there.  The meat itself is average.  It seems like meat I can buy at Aldi's and make my own burger for cheaper (this is not a knock on Aldi's burgers...they are actually pretty good).  I barely tasted the letture or tomato cause they were drenched in mayard.  The price was $7 even for the double cheeseburger, fries, and a drink.  The fries were ok...nothing amazing either.  The drink was pretty good...I got a grape fanta.   In the end, I'll be back cause it is like a 30 second walk from my job...they are quick...and there isn't many options for a super quick lunch on those days that I need to get work done.  If I worked two blocks farther in any direction, I'd never come again. I'll update this when I try out the beef or something else...
Great place, quick service and good food too. I had veggie burger after such a long time as I hardly get them in other places.  The staff is polite and the fries are great

Best independent burger joint I've frequented in the loop.  I know they sell more than burgers but I fall in the trap here of always ordering the same thing: double cheeseburger combo w/fries and a pop (or lemonade).  This cost $6 even until recently-- now I think it's a little under $7 after tax.  I see lots of people come in here ordering pasta or sausages or Italian beefs, but all i can stand behind is the double cheeseburger: I think it's two 1/4 patties, two slices American cheese, decent quality lettuce/tomato/onion, particularly the onion.  The fellas behind the counter are extremely friendly, seem to recognize me even though I only go in once a month or so, and the baldy who'll take your order, in my mind, is the quintessential Chicago fast food order taker.

I was craving a hot dog and I work in the loop and came across Max's. I thought I would give it a try. The hot dogs were pretty good with a good snap when you bite into them and the sport peppers were fresh. The only downside was that the buns had no poppy seeds on them and the fry's were not fresh cut but rather frozen and bagged. A true hot dog joint should take pride in their fries.

I wanted to try this place because of the ratings posted here.  I wasn't let down.  It's not the best burger I've ever had, but it ranks pretty high.  I actually walked by this place the first time trying to use the gps on my phone.  It's pretty small, but these guys are fast, and they don't wait until your are at the counter to ask what you want.  The service was fast, and price was right for a burger, fry, and drink. I wouldn't recommend this place to sit down and eat, especially if the place is packed.  I got my meal to go, and walked over to the park to enjoy my meal.

I had the jumbo dog today.  Very good.  And the fries were again good.  Nice and crisp.  I like to check the fries on consecutive visits, because good fries can be a one-time anomaly. I intentionally peered into the kitchen, because I have coworkers who think the place is grungy.  Definitely not!  It is very clean.

We stopped in and grabbed some gyros, "everything" on it only includes tomatoes and onions. That was a little different for me. They have MANY great lunch specials that include, sandwich, fries and a drink, good deal. Be ready to order what you want as soon as you step in through the doors, they are on it! It's amazing our they got through 20  orders in such a fast pace. We ate inside the very small establishment at the small counter provided and sat upon round bar stools. It was quick and good. Not a lot of pizzazz, but it did what we needed it to do. It appeared as many customers were regulars, as the employee looked at someone and stated what their order was and then the customer nodded and said, "yep, you're right". It is cheap! We will return!

Despite working within spitting distance of Max's for 3+ years, I've never been here before. The look of the place scared me away. But after reading good reviews on here, I decided it was a good choice for the second stop of my April Fresh tour. So I gave it a shot! I like being able to order online, and Max's allows you to do so. The web site was responsive and easy to use. I completed my order in minimal time, and saved 10% since this was my first online order. I also earned 6 loyalty points. And only $6 for a meal...so far, so good! But when I arrived at the restaurant a bit under 10 minutes later, not only was my order not ready*, they hadn't even noticed it yet. They didn't look it up on their screen until I got there and said I was there for an Internet order. Oh well, they started on it right away and I settled in to wait. Luckily I didn't have to wait too long. They were fairly quick. I got my food and drink and left. I got back and hungrily freed the food from its brown paper confines. Hmm, what's this? I ordered cheddar cheese. Either they got my order wrong and gave me American or their "cheddar cheese" is processed into oblivion just like American. Either way, not a fan. But I dug in anyway. At least there was no mayo... that would have been a deal breaker. The fries were pretty good, but I recommend eating them fast. They lose their luster quickly when they cool down. Cheese problem aside, the cheeseburger itself was all right. It really wasn't anything to write home about. The people working there were nice, but the place is a real dive inside. I don't care that much about the look of a place if the food and service is good... but all in all Max's did not live up to my expectations. This place is so close, I'll probably give them another chance. Everyone is allowed an off day every now and then. It will probably be awhile before I get back there however, as I don't eat that kind of food very often. *Amendment: Lest I be thought of as unreasonable, I'd like to clarify that I didn't expect the order to necessarily be ready when I arrived, but I thought that they'd at least be aware of it. Internet communication is effectively instantaneous, so it should be just like ordering over the phone.
Get the hot dogs, they are brilliant.   The cheeseburgers are good, but not great.  I could eat about 4 of their dogs however.
Less than 5 dollars for lunch, and a pretty good one too.  Also, insanely fast and polite service.

I love just how mad fast these people are. They go, "you ready to order?" and you order, within 2 minutes you have your food. BRILLIANT.  The Polish isn't great, it needs to be charred and it isn't. The hot dog hits the spot.

As part of my ongoing quest to try every lunch spot in the loop, today's appointment was with Max's Burgers, Beef, and Hot Dogs...specifically a Jumbo Dog Lunch Special. Mmm.  Spent $5 on lunch and am now full of delicious dog and fries and Dr. Pepper. And we ate at the little counter right in the place. They played some good music. It was definitely the fastest lunch I've had so far, too!

Good food, good service, good prices - if you're looking for a tasty hotdog or burger in the Loop, this is the place to go.  By the time you read this review, you could have placed and received your lunch order! That's how quickly the line moves :)

I patronized this closet sized restaurant before catching a movie the other day and was not disappointed by anything. I got the enigmatic gyro burger and fries mostly out of curiosity and was pleasantly surprised at the fairly decent burger gyro love child I was promptly served. Decent portions, decent food, and a decent price along with fast and friendly service makes this place pretty note worthy.
Good tasty double cheeseburger.  Quick, decent price.

Oh hell yeah! I was craving a Chicago-style dog from the moment I got the invitation to the wedding and knew I would be traveling to Chicago. This place was perfect. Not a touristy looking place, just a little joint. My dog only had one drawback, no poppy seeds on the bun. Otherwise, Max's rocked. Make sure you order it with everything.

my buddy jeremy, a native of chicago living in miami, drives to fort lauderdale after being up all night taking call to eat at the only place in south florida that offers an authentic chicago-style hot dog. i used to think this was ridiculous, but after eating at max's two times in a 24-hour period, i understand why he does it. i will crave the hot dog special with yellow mustard, tomato, fluorescent sweet relish, a sliced pickle, and "sport peppers" for a long time after i've left this very cool city.

What can I say? I'm stumped! How do they make some of the best burgers in so little time? It's so good. The guys are friendly and there's so many items to choose from. I want to just find Max and shake his hand for making some good burgers.

This place is terrific. It's a perfect greasy burger joint - delicious food made to order and quick, friendly service. (Especially Louie, the main counter guy - he remembers his regulars.) Everything is cheap and they give you a lot of food. The place looks like a dump from the outside, but it's really a hidden Loop gem. Don't be daunted by the long line during the lunch rush - the line moves very fast! If you can't stand waiting, you can order ahead online.
Just read the name of the place and you know what you're getting! They have hot dogs, Polish sausage, gyros, Italian beef, and burgers.  It's fast, inexpensive, and a great take-out spot in the Loop.
Not bad.  Great prices!   i love coming here during my lunch break.  and I agree this place is too small to sit down.  take out is the way to go!

Great spot for a quick, cheap bite.  A double cheeseburger, fries and a drink for $6 and change?  That's almost unheard of in the loop, save Mickey D's and the like. The service is friendly and prompt. The ambiance is lacking (okay, who really expects ambiance at a burger stand?).  There is room for 6 or 7 at the counter, otherwise, grab the food to go.

I love me some Chicago dogs.  This place was amazing, it was right on the way to the L station near my hotel.  Dirt cheap, super fast and great dogs.  I recommend this if you're fixing for some greasy processed meat products.

Key Yelp:  A HOT and delicious twist on the ubiquitous Gyro.  Take-out only unless you are incredibly brave. Review:  A good take-out hot dog and burger place.  I was in the mood for a Gyro and they had something I had not seen before: a "hot gyro."  Basically, a typical gyro but with a spicy red sauce on it and tzatziki on the side.   It was very fresh and good.....and this place is pretty inexpensive also.  Fast too!

I work not far from here, and one day on a whim I decided to try out Max's.  It's been five months since I discovered this gem, and I'm hooked! I make it a habit to stop by once per week. I usually get the double cheeseburger special with fries and a pop ($6 with tax!) The hot dogs are petty good, but I really do have to recommend the cheeseburger! The bun is soft, the onions grilled to perfection, and the meat is perfectly seasoned. Service is always great and the people behind the counter are incredibly nice and friendly! Great prices, great food, great service!
i got the italian beef - it was okay.  kind of bland.  i kind of looked enviously at the guy next to us who had gotten the two dogs.  mmm.

Pretty decent place for a quick meal, if you're in the Loop. I was turned on to this place by a friend who works for the School of the Art Institute, just blocks away from here. Never been disappointed w/this place, and the dogs are decent here. Unfortunately, I've only been here once, but I hope to return here at some point, the next time I'm in the Loop.
