Finally, Jack C. is totally right-on about the lunch hour rush between 11:30a-12:30p being very hectic, but at least the staff doesn't complain if you take a little bit of time to decide(since I'm not the type of person who's blessed enough to have a super-fast ability to decide what food to get, unlike others who have this ability. BOO towards those impatient people....). This was also the time of day I went here, the one time I've ever been here.

I just found the BEST gyro I've had in my LIFE here. Got the spicy gyro sandwich.  Wow.  It was SO good and under 5 bucks.   Nice big pieces of gyro meat, this amazing spicy sauce, creamy cucumber sauce...onion, tomato, grilled pita...YUM. What a great place for a quick, cheap eat! I'm going to try their Italian beef next...

I had never been here.  I walk past it twice a day and it just looked like some dumpy place.  Two things made me want to try it - my co-worker came back from there with what looked and smelled like amazing fries and hotdogs and all the great reviews on Yelp! So I strolled over one day for lunch.  Here's what happened: - A single cheeseburger, fries and a drink was less than $5! - I got to choose what I wanted on my burger! - They made it for me AFTER I ordered! I took the stuff back to my office to eat.  It was awesome.  Everybody that saw it was jealous and dreaming about it all day afterward.  The burger isn't super thick...it's a nice size...so if you wanted a double you could technically do it without feeling sick afterward.  The bun was a nice kaiser roll kinda bun.  The pickles were slices of those great cucumbery pickles!  The fries came in adorable little brown bags (sorry, I'm a girl so I couldn't help but think it was a cute little bag) and they are SUPERB.  AHhh...man, if only healthy food tasted this good!

so, i have a family...and occasionally, they like to visit me in chicago.  now, this gives me an excuse to act like a tourist...walk really REEALLY slow, forget how to pay on the CTA, carry american girl bags and the like. but, i kid, i never walk slow! SO fam wants to go to the art institute and i say FOR SURE! so we get off the L and start looking for somewhere to eat because, as my dad said, "if we don't eat something soon, my stomach is going to eat itself." no lie. he's 56...men don't ever grow up!!  we walk and look and find MAX's!! so good...great dogs. just what the "fake tourist family" wanted. check it out!! delish.
Like the guy below me said, CHEAP EATS! The dogs are just as good as Byron's and the prices are some of the cheapest in the city.

CHEAP EATS! A decent char house within the Loop that is reasonably priced!  Can't beat this..  It was a great surprise to see the prices; you can get a double cheeseburger meal, med fries and large drink for $6 bucks.  The bun was quality, cheeseburger was tasty and filling. Most char items are under $5 bucks. They've got a breakfast menu that seems to rival Mcdonalds' . I found one item funny, spaghetti w/sauce $1.99. Gyro's & Italian Beef available. Oh yea.. this is not the cute place it once may have been in Renda H's review, its a small armpit now.

I work less than a street away from Max's, and love to drop in for a quick dog to go. Excellent hot dogs, burgers and fries with a variety of side items and toppings (chili cheese dogs are good, but brace yourself for later). I recommend takeout because the place is small, but there are a few diner-style stools with shallow counters along the walls if you'd like to stay put. The staff is great, especially the guy who takes people's orders. Speaking of orders, do yourself (and others behind you) a favor if you're there when it's very busy (11:30am-12:30pm) -- know what you want ahead of time, and be ready to order when you step to the counter. People get surly when you waste their time, although the staff never complain.
This place is currently undergoing construction but it's a great place to stop for a quick lunch in the loop.  When I'm craving an unhealthy cheeseburger, Max's is the place to hit the spot.
They've got great hot dogs and italian beef here!  The staff is super friendly and the place is so cute!  Its the perfect place to stop for lunch in the loop.
